scope="row">\n         <div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">\n          \xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Total\n         </div>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <span class="nowrap">\n          $18.558 trillion\n         </span>\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-imf2_13-2">\n          <a href="#cite_note-imf2-13">\n           [10]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         (\n         <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal)">\n          1st\n         </a>\n         )\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr class="mergedbottomrow">\n        <th scope="row">\n         <div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">\n          \xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Per capita\n         </div>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         $57,467\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14">\n          <a href="#cite_note-14">\n           [11]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         (\n         <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)_per_capita" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal) per capita">\n          7th\n         </a>\n         )\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         <a href="/wiki/Gini_coefficient" title="Gini coefficient">\n          Gini\n         </a>\n         <span style="font-weight:normal;">\n          (2013)\n         </span>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <img alt="Negative increase" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Increase_Negative.svg/11px-Increase_Negative.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Increase_Negative.svg/17px-Increase_Negative.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Increase_Negative.svg/22px-Increase_Negative.svg.png 2x" title="Negative increase" width="11"/>\n         41.1\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-15">\n          <a href="#cite_note-15">\n           [12]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         <br/>\n         <span style="white-space:nowrap;">\n          <span style="color:orange">\n           medium\n          </span>\n         </span>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         <a href="/wiki/Human_Development_Index" title="Human Development Index">\n          HDI\n         </a>\n         <span style="font-weight:normal;">\n          (2015)\n         </span>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <img alt="Increase" data-file-height="300" data-file-width="300" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Increase2.svg/11px-Increase2.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Increase2.svg/17px-Increase2.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b0/Increase2.svg/22px-Increase2.svg.png 2x" title="Increase" width="11"/>\n         0.920\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HDI_16-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-HDI-16">\n           [13]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         <br/>\n         <span style="white-space:nowrap;">\n          <span style="color:darkgreen">\n           very high\n          </span>\n         </span>\n         \xc2\xb7\n         <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Human_Development_Index" title="List of countries by Human Development Index">\n          10th\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         Currency\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/United_States_dollar" title="United States dollar">\n          United States dollar\n         </a>\n         ($) (\n         <a href="/wiki/ISO_4217" title="ISO 4217">\n          USD\n         </a>\n         )\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr class="mergedtoprow">\n        <th scope="row">\n         Time zone\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <span class="nowrap">\n          (\n          <a href="/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time" title="Coordinated Universal Time">\n           UTC\n          </a>\n          \xe2\x88\x924 to \xe2\x88\x9212, +10, +11)\n         </span>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr class="mergedbottomrow">\n        <th scope="row">\n         <div style="text-indent:-0.9em;margin-left:1.2em;font-weight:normal;">\n          \xe2\x80\xa2\xc2\xa0Summer\xc2\xa0(\n          <a href="/wiki/Daylight_saving_time" title="Daylight saving time">\n           DST\n          </a>\n          )\n         </div>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         (\n         <a href="/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time" title="Coordinated Universal Time">\n          UTC\n         </a>\n         \xe2\x88\x924 to \xe2\x88\x9210\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-time_17-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-time-17">\n           [fn 4]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         )\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         Date format\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         mm/dd/yyyy\xc2\xa0(\n         <a href="/wiki/Anno_Domini" title="Anno Domini">\n          AD\n         </a>\n         )\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Right-_and_left-hand_traffic" title="Right- and left-hand traffic">\n          Drives on the\n         </a>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         right\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-drive_18-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-drive-18">\n           [fn 5]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_the_United_States" title="Telephone numbers in the United States">\n          Calling code\n         </a>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/North_American_Numbering_Plan" title="North American Numbering Plan">\n          +1\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         <a href="/wiki/ISO_3166" title="ISO 3166">\n          ISO 3166 code\n         </a>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/ISO_3166-2:US" title="ISO 3166-2:US">\n          US\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <th scope="row">\n         <a href="/wiki/Country_code_top-level_domain" title="Country code top-level domain">\n          Internet TLD\n         </a>\n        </th>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/.us" title=".us">\n          .us\n         </a>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td colspan="2" style="text-align:center">\n         <div style="line-height:11pt">\n          <b>\n           Website\n          </b>\n          <br/>\n          <a class="external text" href="https://www.usa.gov/" rel="nofollow">\n           usa.gov\n          </a>\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <b>\n        United States of America\n       </b>\n       (\n       <b>\n        USA\n       </b>\n       ), commonly known as the\n       <b>\n        United States\n       </b>\n       (\n       <b>\n        U.S.\n       </b>\n       ) or\n       <b>\n        America\n       </b>\n       (\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt">\n         <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">\n          /\n          <span style="border-bottom:1px dotted">\n           <span title="/\xc9\x99/: \'a\' in \'about\'">\n            \xc9\x99\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xcb\x88/: primary stress follows">\n            \xcb\x88\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'m\' in \'my\'">\n            m\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xc9\x9b/: \'e\' in \'dress\'">\n            \xc9\x9b\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'r\' in \'rye\'">\n            r\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xc9\xaa/: \'i\' in \'kit\'">\n            \xc9\xaa\n           </span>\n           <span title="\'k\' in \'kind\'">\n            k\n           </span>\n           <span title="/\xc9\x99/: \'a\' in \'about\'">\n            \xc9\x99\n           </span>\n          </span>\n          /\n         </a>\n        </span>\n       </span>\n       ), is a\n       <a href="/wiki/Federal_republic" title="Federal republic">\n        federal republic\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEThe_New_York_Times2007670_19-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEThe_New_York_Times2007670-19">\n         [14]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEOnuf2010xvii_20-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEOnuf2010xvii-20">\n         [15]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       composed of 50\n       <a href="/wiki/U.S._state" title="U.S. state">\n        states\n       </a>\n       , a\n       <a href="/wiki/Washington,_D.C." title="Washington, D.C.">\n        federal district\n       </a>\n       , five major\n       <a href="/wiki/Territories_of_the_United_States" title="Territories of the United States">\n        self-governing territories\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Minor_Outlying_Islands" title="United States Minor Outlying Islands">\n        various possessions\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-22">\n        <a href="#cite_note-22">\n         [fn 6]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       At 3.8\xc2\xa0million square miles (9.8\xc2\xa0million km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       )\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-urlState_Area_Measurements_and_Internal_Point_Coordinates_-_Geography_-_U.S._Census_Bureau_23-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-urlState_Area_Measurements_and_Internal_Point_Coordinates_-_Geography_-_U.S._Census_Bureau-23">\n         [17]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and with over 325 million people, the United States is the world\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area" title="List of countries and dependencies by area">\n        third- or fourth-largest country by total area\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-28">\n        <a href="#cite_note-28">\n         [fn 7]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_population" title="List of countries and dependencies by population">\n        third-most populous\n       </a>\n       . The capital is\n       <a href="/wiki/Washington,_D.C." title="Washington, D.C.">\n        Washington, D.C.\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population" title="List of United States cities by population">\n        largest city by population\n       </a>\n       is\n       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">\n        New York City\n       </a>\n       . Forty-eight states and the capital\'s federal district are\n       <a href="/wiki/Contiguous_United_States" title="Contiguous United States">\n        contiguous\n       </a>\n       and located in\n       <a href="/wiki/North_America" title="North America">\n        North America\n       </a>\n       between\n       <a href="/wiki/Canada" title="Canada">\n        Canada\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">\n        Mexico\n       </a>\n       . The\n       <a href="/wiki/Alaska" title="Alaska">\n        state of Alaska\n       </a>\n       is in the northwest corner of North America, bordered by Canada to the east and across the\n       <a href="/wiki/Bering_Strait" title="Bering Strait">\n        Bering Strait\n       </a>\n       from\n       <a href="/wiki/Russia" title="Russia">\n        Russia\n       </a>\n       to the west. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Hawaii" title="Hawaii">\n        state of Hawaii\n       </a>\n       is an\n       <a href="/wiki/Archipelago" title="Archipelago">\n        archipelago\n       </a>\n       in the mid-\n       <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Ocean" title="Pacific Ocean">\n        Pacific Ocean\n       </a>\n       . The U.S.\n       <a href="/wiki/Territories_of_the_United_States" title="Territories of the United States">\n        territories\n       </a>\n       are scattered about the Pacific Ocean and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Caribbean_Sea" title="Caribbean Sea">\n        Caribbean Sea\n       </a>\n       , stretching across nine official\n       <a href="/wiki/Time_in_the_United_States" title="Time in the United States">\n        time zones\n       </a>\n       . The extremely diverse\n       <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_the_United_States" title="Geography of the United States">\n        geography\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Climate_of_the_United_States" title="Climate of the United States">\n        climate\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Fauna_of_the_United_States" title="Fauna of the United States">\n        wildlife\n       </a>\n       of the United States make it one of the world\'s 17\n       <a href="/wiki/Megadiverse_countries" title="Megadiverse countries">\n        megadiverse countries\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-urlMegadiverse_Countries_definition_.7C_Biodiversity_A-Z_29-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-urlMegadiverse_Countries_definition_.7C_Biodiversity_A-Z-29">\n         [22]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Paleo-Indians" title="Paleo-Indians">\n        Paleo-Indians\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Settlement_of_the_Americas" title="Settlement of the Americas">\n        migrated from Asia\n       </a>\n       to the North American mainland at least 15,000 years ago.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEErlandsonRickVellanoweth200819_30-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEErlandsonRickVellanoweth200819-30">\n         [23]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/European_colonization_of_the_Americas" title="European colonization of the Americas">\n        European colonization\n       </a>\n       began in the 16th century. The United States emerged from the\n       <a href="/wiki/Thirteen_Colonies" title="Thirteen Colonies">\n        thirteen British colonies\n       </a>\n       established along the\n       <a href="/wiki/East_Coast_of_the_United_States" title="East Coast of the United States">\n        East Coast\n       </a>\n       . Numerous disputes between\n       <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Great_Britain" title="Kingdom of Great Britain">\n        Great Britain\n       </a>\n       and the colonies following the\n       <a href="/wiki/Seven_Years%27_War" title="Seven Years\' War">\n        French and Indian War\n       </a>\n       led to the\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Revolution" title="American Revolution">\n        American Revolution\n       </a>\n       , which began in 1775, and the subsequent\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Declaration_of_Independence" title="United States Declaration of Independence">\n        Declaration of Independence\n       </a>\n       in 1776. The war\n       <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Paris_(1783)" title="Treaty of Paris (1783)">\n        ended in 1783\n       </a>\n       with the United States becoming the first country to gain independence from a\n       <a href="/wiki/Colonial_empire" title="Colonial empire">\n        European power\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-31">\n        <a href="#cite_note-31">\n         [24]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Constitution" title="United States Constitution">\n        current constitution\n       </a>\n       was adopted in 1788, with the first ten amendments, collectively named the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Bill_of_Rights" title="United States Bill of Rights">\n        Bill of Rights\n       </a>\n       , being ratified in 1791 to guarantee many\n       <a href="/wiki/Natural_and_legal_rights" title="Natural and legal rights">\n        fundamental civil liberties\n       </a>\n       . The United States embarked on a vigorous expansion across North America throughout the 19th century,\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_territorial_acquisitions" title="United States territorial acquisitions">\n        acquiring new territories\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MD2007_32-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MD2007-32">\n         [25]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Indian_Wars" title="American Indian Wars">\n        displacing Native American tribes\n       </a>\n       , and gradually\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_by_date_of_admission_to_the_Union" title="List of U.S. states by date of admission to the Union">\n        admitting new states\n       </a>\n       until it spanned the continent by 1848.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MD2007_32-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-MD2007-32">\n         [25]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       During the second half of the 19th century, the\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Civil_War" title="American Civil War">\n        Civil War\n       </a>\n       led to the outlawing of\n       <a href="/wiki/Slavery_in_the_United_States" title="Slavery in the United States">\n        slavery\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-33">\n        <a href="#cite_note-33">\n         [26]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-34">\n        <a href="#cite_note-34">\n         [27]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       By the end of the century, the United States had extended into the Pacific Ocean,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-AmCentNYT_35-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-AmCentNYT-35">\n         [28]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and its economy, driven in large part by the\n       <a href="/wiki/Industrial_Revolution" title="Industrial Revolution">\n        Industrial Revolution\n       </a>\n       , began to soar.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-36">\n        <a href="#cite_note-36">\n         [29]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Spanish%E2%80%93American_War" title="Spanish\xe2\x80\x93American War">\n        Spanish\xe2\x80\x93American War\n       </a>\n       and\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/World_War_I" title="World War I">\n         World War I\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       confirmed the country\'s status as a global military power. The United States emerged from\n       <span class="nowrap">\n        <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">\n         World War II\n        </a>\n       </span>\n       as a global\n       <a href="/wiki/Superpower" title="Superpower">\n        superpower\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nuclear_weapons_and_the_United_States" title="Nuclear weapons and the United States">\n        first country to develop nuclear weapons\n       </a>\n       , the only country to\n       <a href="/wiki/Atomic_bombings_of_Hiroshima_and_Nagasaki" title="Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki">\n        use them in warfare\n       </a>\n       , and a\n       <a href="/wiki/Permanent_members_of_the_United_Nations_Security_Council" title="Permanent members of the United Nations Security Council">\n        permanent member\n       </a>\n       of the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council" title="United Nations Security Council">\n        United Nations Security Council\n       </a>\n       . During the\n       <a href="/wiki/Cold_War" title="Cold War">\n        Cold War\n       </a>\n       , the United States and the Soviet Union competed in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Space_Race" title="Space Race">\n        Space Race\n       </a>\n       , culminating with the\n       <a href="/wiki/Apollo_11" title="Apollo 11">\n        1969 moon landing\n       </a>\n       . The end of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Cold_War" title="Cold War">\n        Cold War\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Dissolution_of_the_Soviet_Union" title="Dissolution of the Soviet Union">\n        collapse of the Soviet Union\n       </a>\n       in 1991 left the United States as the world\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Hyperpower" title="Hyperpower">\n        sole superpower\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-37">\n        <a href="#cite_note-37">\n         [30]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The United States is a founding member of the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">\n        United Nations\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">\n        World Bank\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund" title="International Monetary Fund">\n        International Monetary Fund\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Organization_of_American_States" title="Organization of American States">\n        Organization of American States\n       </a>\n       (OAS), and other international organizations. The United States is a highly\n       <a href="/wiki/Developed_country" title="Developed country">\n        developed country\n       </a>\n       , with the world\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal)">\n        largest economy by nominal GDP\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(PPP)" title="List of countries by GDP (PPP)">\n        second-largest economy by PPP\n       </a>\n       , accounting for approximately a quarter of global GDP.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-38">\n        <a href="#cite_note-38">\n         [31]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_the_United_States" title="Economy of the United States">\n        U.S. economy\n       </a>\n       is the fastest-growing in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Americas" title="Americas">\n        Americas\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IMFSouthAmericaGDP_39-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-IMFSouthAmericaGDP-39">\n         [32]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IMFNorthAmericaGDP_40-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-IMFNorthAmericaGDP-40">\n         [33]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and is largely\n       <a href="/wiki/Post-industrial_society" title="Post-industrial society">\n        post-industrial\n       </a>\n       , characterized by the dominance of\n       <a href="/wiki/Service_(economics)" title="Service (economics)">\n        services\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Knowledge_economy" title="Knowledge economy">\n        knowledge-based\n       </a>\n       activities, although the manufacturing sector remains the second-largest in the world.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-41">\n        <a href="#cite_note-41">\n         [34]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Though its population is only 4.3% of the world total,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-urlPopulation_Clock_11-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-urlPopulation_Clock-11">\n         [8]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Americans hold\n       <a href="/wiki/National_wealth" title="National wealth">\n        33.2% of the total wealth in the world\n       </a>\n       , the largest share of global wealth concentrated in a single country.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-42">\n        <a href="#cite_note-42">\n         [35]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The United States\n       <a href="/wiki/International_rankings_of_the_United_States" title="International rankings of the United States">\n        ranks among the highest\n       </a>\n       nations in several measures of socioeconomic performance, including\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_average_wage" title="List of countries by average wage">\n        average wage\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-43">\n        <a href="#cite_note-43">\n         [36]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Human_Development_Index" title="Human Development Index">\n        human development\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)_per_capita" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal) per capita">\n        per capita GDP\n       </a>\n       , and productivity per person.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-44">\n        <a href="#cite_note-44">\n         [37]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The U.S. is the foremost\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Armed_Forces" title="United States Armed Forces">\n        military\n       </a>\n       power in the world, making up a third of\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_military_expenditures" title="List of countries by military expenditures">\n        global military spending\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-45">\n        <a href="#cite_note-45">\n         [38]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       It is also a global leader in\n       <a href="/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_the_United_States" title="Science and technology in the United States">\n        science and technology\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n      </p>\n      <div class="toc" id="toc">\n       <div class="toctitle">\n        <h2>\n         Contents\n        </h2>\n       </div>\n       <ul>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-1">\n         <a href="#Etymology">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           1\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Etymology\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-2">\n         <a href="#History">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           2\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           History\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-3">\n           <a href="#Indigenous_peoples_and_pre-Columbian_history">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Indigenous peoples and pre-Columbian history\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-4">\n           <a href="#European_settlements">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             European settlements\n            </span>\n           </a>\n           <ul>\n            <li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-5">\n             <a href="#Effects_on_and_interaction_with_native_populations">\n              <span class="tocnumber">\n               2.2.1\n              </span>\n              <span class="toctext">\n               Effects on and interaction with native populations\n              </span>\n             </a>\n            </li>\n           </ul>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-6">\n           <a href="#Independence_and_expansion_.281776.E2.80.931865.29">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Independence and expansion (1776\xe2\x80\x931865)\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-7">\n           <a href="#Civil_War_and_Reconstruction_Era">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Civil War and Reconstruction Era\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-8">\n           <a href="#Further_immigration.2C_expansion.2C_and_industrialization">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.5\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Further immigration, expansion, and industrialization\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-9">\n           <a href="#World_War_I.2C_Great_Depression.2C_and_World_War_II">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.6\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             World War I, Great Depression, and World War II\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-10">\n           <a href="#Cold_War_and_civil_rights_era">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.7\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Cold War and civil rights era\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-11">\n           <a href="#Contemporary_history">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             2.8\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Contemporary history\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-12">\n         <a href="#Geography.2C_climate.2C_and_environment">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           3\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Geography, climate, and environment\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-13">\n           <a href="#Wildlife">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             3.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Wildlife\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-14">\n         <a href="#Demographics">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           4\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Demographics\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-15">\n           <a href="#Population">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             4.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Population\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-16">\n           <a href="#Language">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             4.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Language\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-17">\n           <a href="#Religion">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             4.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Religion\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-18">\n           <a href="#Family_structure">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             4.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Family structure\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-19">\n         <a href="#Government_and_politics">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           5\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Government and politics\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-20">\n           <a href="#Political_divisions">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Political divisions\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-21">\n           <a href="#Parties_and_elections">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Parties and elections\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-22">\n           <a href="#Foreign_relations">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Foreign relations\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-23">\n           <a href="#Government_finance">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Government finance\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-24">\n           <a href="#Military">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             5.5\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Military\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-25">\n         <a href="#Law_enforcement_and_crime">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           6\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Law enforcement and crime\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-26">\n         <a href="#Economy">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           7\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Economy\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-27">\n           <a href="#Income.2C_poverty_and_wealth">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             7.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Income, poverty and wealth\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-28">\n         <a href="#Infrastructure">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           8\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Infrastructure\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-29">\n           <a href="#Transportation">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             8.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Transportation\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-30">\n           <a href="#Energy">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             8.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Energy\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-31">\n           <a href="#Water_supply_and_sanitation">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             8.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Water supply and sanitation\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-32">\n         <a href="#Education">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           9\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Education\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-33">\n         <a href="#Culture">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           10\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Culture\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-34">\n           <a href="#Food">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             10.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Food\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-35">\n           <a href="#Literature.2C_philosophy.2C_and_the_arts">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             10.2\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Literature, philosophy, and the arts\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-36">\n           <a href="#Music">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             10.3\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Music\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-37">\n           <a href="#Cinema">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             10.4\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Cinema\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-38">\n           <a href="#Sports">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             10.5\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Sports\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-39">\n           <a href="#Media">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             10.6\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Media\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-40">\n         <a href="#Science_and_technology">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           11\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Science and technology\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-41">\n         <a href="#Health">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           12\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Health\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-42">\n         <a href="#See_also">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           13\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           See also\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-43">\n         <a href="#Notes">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           14\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Notes\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-44">\n         <a href="#References">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           15\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           References\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-45">\n         <a href="#Bibliography">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           16\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           Bibliography\n          </span>\n         </a>\n         <ul>\n          <li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-46">\n           <a href="#Internet_sources">\n            <span class="tocnumber">\n             16.1\n            </span>\n            <span class="toctext">\n             Internet sources\n            </span>\n           </a>\n          </li>\n         </ul>\n        </li>\n        <li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-47">\n         <a href="#External_links">\n          <span class="tocnumber">\n           17\n          </span>\n          <span class="toctext">\n           External links\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </li>\n       </ul>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Etymology">\n        Etymology\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Naming_of_America" title="Naming of America">\n        Naming of America\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Names_for_United_States_citizens" title="Names for United States citizens">\n        Names for United States citizens\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/American_(word)" title="American (word)">\n        American (word)\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tleft">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:142px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="433" data-file-width="359" height="169" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg/140px-Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg/210px-Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg/280px-Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg 2x" width="140"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Amerigo_Vespucci_-_Project_Gutenberg_etext_19997.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         The\n         <i>\n          Americas\n         </i>\n         are named after Italian explorer\n         <a href="/wiki/Amerigo_Vespucci" title="Amerigo Vespucci">\n          Amerigo Vespucci\n         </a>\n         .\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMartone2016504_46-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMartone2016504-46">\n           [39]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       In 1507, the German cartographer\n       <a href="/wiki/Martin_Waldseem%C3%BCller" title="Martin Waldseem\xc3\xbcller">\n        Martin Waldseem\xc3\xbcller\n       </a>\n       produced a world map on which he named the lands of the Western Hemisphere\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Americas" title="Americas">\n         America\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       in honor of the Italian explorer and cartographer\n       <a href="/wiki/Amerigo_Vespucci" title="Amerigo Vespucci">\n        Amerigo Vespucci\n       </a>\n       (\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Latin_language" title="Latin language">\n        Latin\n       </a>\n       :\n       <span lang="la">\n        <i>\n         Americus Vespucius\n        </i>\n       </span>\n       ).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESider2007226_47-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESider2007226-47">\n         [40]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The first documentary evidence of the phrase "United States of America" is from a letter dated January 2, 1776, written by\n       <a href="/wiki/Stephen_Moylan" title="Stephen Moylan">\n        Stephen Moylan\n       </a>\n       , Esq.,\n       <a href="/wiki/George_Washington" title="George Washington">\n        George Washington\n       </a>\n       \'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Aide-de-camp" title="Aide-de-camp">\n        aide-de-camp\n       </a>\n       and Muster-Master General of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Continental_Army" title="Continental Army">\n        Continental Army\n       </a>\n       . Addressed to\n       <a href="/wiki/Joseph_Reed_(politician)" title="Joseph Reed (politician)">\n        Lt. Col. Joseph Reed\n       </a>\n       , Moylan expressed his wish to carry the "full and ample powers of the United States of America" to Spain to assist in the revolutionary war effort.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-48">\n        <a href="#cite_note-48">\n         [41]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-49">\n        <a href="#cite_note-49">\n         [42]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-50">\n        <a href="#cite_note-50">\n         [43]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The first known publication of the phrase "United States of America" was in an anonymous essay in\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/The_Virginia_Gazette" title="The Virginia Gazette">\n         The Virginia Gazette\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       newspaper in Williamsburg, Virginia, on April 6, 1776.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-51">\n        <a href="#cite_note-51">\n         [44]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The second draft of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Articles_of_Confederation" title="Articles of Confederation">\n        Articles of Confederation\n       </a>\n       , prepared by\n       <a href="/wiki/John_Dickinson" title="John Dickinson">\n        John Dickinson\n       </a>\n       and completed by June 17, 1776, at the latest, declared "The name of this Confederation shall be the \'United States of America\n       <span style="padding-right:.2em;">\n        \'\n       </span>\n       ".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESafire2003199_52-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESafire2003199-52">\n         [45]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The final version of the Articles sent to the states for ratification in late 1777 contains the sentence "The Stile of this Confederacy shall be \'The United States of America\n       <span style="padding-right:.2em;">\n        \'\n       </span>\n       ".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMostert200518_53-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEMostert200518-53">\n         [46]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In June 1776,\n       <a href="/wiki/Thomas_Jefferson" title="Thomas Jefferson">\n        Thomas Jefferson\n       </a>\n       wrote the phrase "UNITED STATES OF AMERICA" in all capitalized letters in the headline of his "original Rough draught" of the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Declaration_of_Independence" title="United States Declaration of Independence">\n        Declaration of Independence\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESafire2003199_52-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESafire2003199-52">\n         [45]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       This draft of the document did not surface until June 21, 1776, and it is unclear whether it was written before or after Dickinson used the term in his June 17 draft of the Articles of Confederation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTESafire2003199_52-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTESafire2003199-52">\n         [45]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The short form "United States" is also standard. Other common forms are the "U.S.", the "USA", and "America". Colloquial names are the "U.S. of A." and, internationally, the "States". "\n       <a href="/wiki/Columbia_(name)" title="Columbia (name)">\n        Columbia\n       </a>\n       ", a name popular in poetry and songs of the late 18th century, derives its origin from\n       <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Columbus" title="Christopher Columbus">\n        Christopher Columbus\n       </a>\n       ; it appears in the name "\n       <a href="/wiki/Washington,_D.C." title="Washington, D.C.">\n        District of Columbia\n       </a>\n       ".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Brokenshire1_54-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Brokenshire1-54">\n         [47]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The phrase "United States" was originally plural, a description of a collection of independent states\xe2\x80\x94e.g., "the United States are"\xe2\x80\x94including in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Thirteenth_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution" title="Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution">\n        Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution\n       </a>\n       , ratified in 1865.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGreg1892276_55-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGreg1892276-55">\n         [48]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The singular form\xe2\x80\x94e.g., "the United States is"\xe2\x80\x94became popular after the end of the American Civil War. The singular form is now standard; the plural form is retained in the idiom "these United States". The difference is more significant than usage; it is a difference between a collection of states and a unit.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-56">\n        <a href="#cite_note-56">\n         [49]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       A citizen of the United States is an "\n       <a href="/wiki/Americans" title="Americans">\n        American\n       </a>\n       ". "United States", "American" and "U.S." refer to the country adjectivally ("American values", "U.S.\xc2\xa0forces"). In English, the word "\n       <a href="/wiki/American_(word)" title="American (word)">\n        American\n       </a>\n       " rarely refers to topics or subjects not connected with the United States.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-57">\n        <a href="#cite_note-57">\n         [50]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="History">\n        History\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/History_of_the_United_States" title="History of the United States">\n        History of the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_United_States_history" title="Timeline of United States history">\n        Timeline of United States history\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/American_business_history" title="American business history">\n        American business history\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Economic_history_of_the_United_States" title="Economic history of the United States">\n        Economic history of the United States\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Labor_history_of_the_United_States" title="Labor history of the United States">\n        Labor history of the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Indigenous_peoples_and_pre-Columbian_history">\n        Indigenous peoples and pre-Columbian history\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/Pre-Columbian_era" title="Pre-Columbian era">\n        Pre-Columbian era\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Colonial_history_of_the_United_States" title="Colonial history of the United States">\n        Colonial history of the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="503" height="175" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg/220px-Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg/330px-Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg/440px-Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Chromesun_kincaid_site_01.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         Artist\'s re-creation of the\n         <a href="/wiki/Kincaid_Mounds_State_Historic_Site" title="Kincaid Mounds State Historic Site">\n          Kincaid Site\n         </a>\n         from the prehistoric Mississippian culture, as it may have looked\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dalal2011_58-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-Dalal2011-58">\n           [51]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Settlement_of_the_Americas" title="Settlement of the Americas">\n        first inhabitants of North America\n       </a>\n       migrated from\n       <a href="/wiki/Siberia" title="Siberia">\n        Siberia\n       </a>\n       by way of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Beringia" title="Beringia">\n        Bering land bridge\n       </a>\n       and arrived at least 15,000 years ago, though increasing evidence suggests an even earlier arrival.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-earliest_59-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-earliest-59">\n         [52]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       After crossing the land bridge, the first Americans moved southward, either along the Pacific coast\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-60">\n        <a href="#cite_note-60">\n         [53]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-61">\n        <a href="#cite_note-61">\n         [54]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       or through an interior ice-free corridor between the Cordilleran and Laurentide ice sheets.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Geotimes_corridor_62-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Geotimes_corridor-62">\n         [55]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Clovis_culture" title="Clovis culture">\n        Clovis culture\n       </a>\n       appeared around 11,000 BC, and it is considered to be an ancestor of most of the later indigenous cultures of the Americas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Waters_63-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Waters-63">\n         [56]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       While the Clovis culture was thought, throughout the late 20th century, to represent the first human settlement of the Americas,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TEF_64-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-TEF-64">\n         [57]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       in recent years consensus has changed in recognition of pre-Clovis cultures.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-65">\n        <a href="#cite_note-65">\n         [58]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Over time, indigenous cultures in North America grew increasingly complex, and some, such as the\n       <a href="/wiki/Pre-Columbian_era" title="Pre-Columbian era">\n        pre-Columbian\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Mississippian_culture" title="Mississippian culture">\n        Mississippian culture\n       </a>\n       in the southeast, developed advanced agriculture, grand architecture, and state-level societies.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Lockard2010_66-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Lockard2010-66">\n         [59]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       From approximately 800 to 1600 AD\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Mississippian_Date_Range_67-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Mississippian_Date_Range-67">\n         [60]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       the Mississippian culture flourished, and its largest city\n       <a href="/wiki/Cahokia" title="Cahokia">\n        Cahokia\n       </a>\n       is considered the largest, most complex pre-Columbian\n       <a href="/wiki/Archaeology" title="Archaeology">\n        archaeological site\n       </a>\n       in the modern-day United States.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NGM_Cahokia_68-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-NGM_Cahokia-68">\n         [61]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In the southern\n       <a href="/wiki/Great_Lakes" title="Great Lakes">\n        Great Lakes\n       </a>\n       region, the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Iroquois_Confederacy" title="Iroquois Confederacy">\n        Iroquois Confederacy\n       </a>\n       (Haudenosaunee) was established at some point between the twelfth\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-69">\n        <a href="#cite_note-69">\n         [62]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and fifteenth centuries,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Dean_Snow_70-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Dean_Snow-70">\n         [63]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       lasting until the end of the Revolutionary War.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Richter11-12_71-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Richter11-12-71">\n         [64]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The date of the first settlements of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Hawaiian_Islands" title="Hawaiian Islands">\n        Hawaiian Islands\n       </a>\n       is a topic of continuing debate.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PearcePearce2010_72-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PearcePearce2010-72">\n         [65]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Archaeology" title="Archaeology">\n        Archaeological\n       </a>\n       evidence seems to indicate a settlement as early as 124 AD.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Whittaker1986_73-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Whittaker1986-73">\n         [66]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       During his\n       <a href="/wiki/James_Cook#Third_voyage_.281776.E2.80.9379.29" title="James Cook">\n        third and final voyage\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Captain_James_Cook" title="Captain James Cook">\n        Captain James Cook\n       </a>\n       became the first European to begin formal contact with Hawaii.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Fish2011_74-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Fish2011-74">\n         [67]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       After his initial landfall in January 1778 at\n       <a href="/wiki/Waimea,_Kauai_County,_Hawaii" title="Waimea, Kauai County, Hawaii">\n        Waimea\n       </a>\n       harbour,\n       <a href="/wiki/Kauai" title="Kauai">\n        Kauai\n       </a>\n       , Cook named the\n       <a href="/wiki/Archipelago" title="Archipelago">\n        archipelago\n       </a>\n       the "Sandwich Islands" after the\n       <a href="/wiki/John_Montagu,_4th_Earl_of_Sandwich" title="John Montagu, 4th Earl of Sandwich">\n        fourth Earl of Sandwich\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94the acting\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lords_Commissioners_of_the_Admiralty" title="Lords Commissioners of the Admiralty">\n        First Lord of the Admiralty\n       </a>\n       of the British\n       <a href="/wiki/Royal_Navy" title="Royal Navy">\n        Royal Navy\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-75">\n        <a href="#cite_note-75">\n         [68]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="European_settlements">\n        European settlements\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/European_colonization_of_the_Americas" title="European colonization of the Americas">\n        European colonization of the Americas\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Thirteen_Colonies" title="Thirteen Colonies">\n        Thirteen Colonies\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="4034" data-file-width="6129" height="145" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg/220px-View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg/330px-View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg/440px-View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:View_of_St._Augustine_FL_at_intersection_of_Cathedral_Pl_and_Charlotte_St_20160707_1.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Saint_Augustine,_Florida" title="Saint Augustine, Florida">\n          Saint Augustine, Florida\n         </a>\n         , the oldest continuously occupied European-established settlement in the continental United States (1565)\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Saint_Augustine_76-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-Saint_Augustine-76">\n           [69]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2233" data-file-width="3170" height="155" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg/220px-The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg/330px-The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg/440px-The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:The_Mayflower_Compact_1620_cph.3g07155.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <i>\n          The\n          <a href="/wiki/Mayflower_Compact" title="Mayflower Compact">\n           Mayflower Compact\n          </a>\n          , 1620\n         </i>\n         by\n         <a href="/wiki/Jean_Leon_Gerome_Ferris" title="Jean Leon Gerome Ferris">\n          Jean Leon Gerome Ferris\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       After Spain sent\n       <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Columbus" title="Christopher Columbus">\n        Columbus\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Voyages_of_Christopher_Columbus#First_voyage" title="Voyages of Christopher Columbus">\n        on his first voyage\n       </a>\n       to the\n       <a href="/wiki/New_World" title="New World">\n        New World\n       </a>\n       in 1492, other explorers followed. The first Europeans to arrive in territory of the modern United States were Spanish\n       <a href="/wiki/Conquistador" title="Conquistador">\n        conquistadors\n       </a>\n       such as\n       <a href="/wiki/Juan_Ponce_de_Le%C3%B3n" title="Juan Ponce de Le\xc3\xb3n">\n        Juan Ponce de Le\xc3\xb3n\n       </a>\n       , who made his first visit to Florida in 1513; however, if\n       <a href="/wiki/Unincorporated_territories_of_the_United_States" title="Unincorporated territories of the United States">\n        unincorporated territories\n       </a>\n       are accounted for, then credit would go to\n       <a href="/wiki/Christopher_Columbus" title="Christopher Columbus">\n        Christopher Columbus\n       </a>\n       who landed in\n       <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Rico" title="Puerto Rico">\n        Puerto Rico\n       </a>\n       on his\n       <a href="/wiki/Voyages_of_Christopher_Columbus#Second_voyage" title="Voyages of Christopher Columbus">\n        1493 voyage\n       </a>\n       . Spanish set up the first settlements in Florida and New Mexico such as\n       <a href="/wiki/St._Augustine,_Florida" title="St. Augustine, Florida">\n        Saint Augustine\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Saint_Augustine_76-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Saint_Augustine-76">\n         [69]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Santa_Fe,_New_Mexico" title="Santa Fe, New Mexico">\n        Santa Fe\n       </a>\n       . The French established their own as well along the\n       <a href="/wiki/Mississippi_River" title="Mississippi River">\n        Mississippi River\n       </a>\n       . Successful\n       <a href="/wiki/English_overseas_possessions" title="English overseas possessions">\n        English settlement\n       </a>\n       on the eastern coast of North America began with the\n       <a href="/wiki/Colony_of_Virginia" title="Colony of Virginia">\n        Virginia Colony\n       </a>\n       in 1607 at\n       <a href="/wiki/Jamestown,_Virginia" title="Jamestown, Virginia">\n        Jamestown\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Pilgrims_(Plymouth_Colony)" title="Pilgrims (Plymouth Colony)">\n        Pilgrims\'\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Plymouth_Colony" title="Plymouth Colony">\n        Plymouth Colony\n       </a>\n       in 1620. Many settlers were\n       <a href="/wiki/English_Dissenters" title="English Dissenters">\n        dissenting Christian groups\n       </a>\n       who came seeking\n       <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_religion" title="Freedom of religion">\n        religious freedom\n       </a>\n       . The continent\'s first elected legislative assembly, Virginia\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/House_of_Burgesses" title="House of Burgesses">\n        House of Burgesses\n       </a>\n       created in 1619, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Mayflower_Compact" title="Mayflower Compact">\n        Mayflower Compact\n       </a>\n       , signed by the Pilgrims before disembarking, and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Fundamental_Orders_of_Connecticut" title="Fundamental Orders of Connecticut">\n        Fundamental Orders of Connecticut\n       </a>\n       , established precedents for the pattern of representative self-government and constitutionalism that would develop throughout the American colonies.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Remini2.E2.80.933_77-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Remini2.E2.80.933-77">\n         [70]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Johnson26.E2.80.9330_78-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Johnson26.E2.80.9330-78">\n         [71]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Most settlers in every colony were small farmers, but other industries developed within a few decades as varied as the settlements.\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cash_crops" title="Cash crops">\n        Cash crops\n       </a>\n       included tobacco, rice and wheat. Extraction industries grew up in furs, fishing and lumber. Manufacturers produced rum and ships, and by the late colonial period Americans were producing one-seventh of the world\'s iron supply.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-79">\n        <a href="#cite_note-79">\n         [72]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Cities eventually dotted the coast to support local economies and serve as trade hubs. English colonists were supplemented by waves of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Scotch-Irish_American" title="Scotch-Irish American">\n        Scotch-Irish\n       </a>\n       and other groups. As coastal land grew more expensive, freed\n       <a href="/wiki/Indentured_servitude" title="Indentured servitude">\n        indentured servants\n       </a>\n       pushed further west.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-80">\n        <a href="#cite_note-80">\n         [73]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       A large-scale slave trade with English privateers was begun.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-81">\n        <a href="#cite_note-81">\n         [74]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The life expectancy of slaves was much higher in North America than further south, because of less disease and better food and treatment, leading to a rapid increase in the numbers of slaves.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-82">\n        <a href="#cite_note-82">\n         [75]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-83">\n        <a href="#cite_note-83">\n         [76]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Colonial society was largely divided over the religious and moral implications of slavery and colonies passed acts for and against the practice.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Lien522_84-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Lien522-84">\n         [77]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Davis7_85-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Davis7-85">\n         [78]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       But by the turn of the 18th century, African slaves were replacing indentured servants for cash crop labor, especially in southern regions.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Quirk2011_86-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Quirk2011-86">\n         [79]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       With the British colonization of\n       <a href="/wiki/Province_of_Georgia" title="Province of Georgia">\n        Georgia\n       </a>\n       in 1732, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Thirteen_Colonies" title="Thirteen Colonies">\n        13 colonies\n       </a>\n       that would become the United States of America were established.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BilhartzElliott2007_87-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-BilhartzElliott2007-87">\n         [80]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       All had local governments with elections open to most free men, with a growing devotion to the ancient\n       <a href="/wiki/Rights_of_Englishmen" title="Rights of Englishmen">\n        rights of Englishmen\n       </a>\n       and a sense of self-government stimulating support for republicanism.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Wood1998_88-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Wood1998-88">\n         [81]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       With extremely high birth rates, low death rates, and steady settlement, the colonial population grew rapidly. Relatively small Native American populations were eclipsed.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-89">\n        <a href="#cite_note-89">\n         [82]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Christian_revival" title="Christian revival">\n        Christian revivalist\n       </a>\n       movement of the 1730s and 1740s known as the\n       <a href="/wiki/First_Great_Awakening" title="First Great Awakening">\n        Great Awakening\n       </a>\n       fueled interest in both religion and religious liberty.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-90">\n        <a href="#cite_note-90">\n         [83]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       During the\n       <a href="/wiki/Seven_Years%27_War" title="Seven Years\' War">\n        Seven Years\' War\n       </a>\n       (in America, known as the\n       <a href="/wiki/French_and_Indian_War" title="French and Indian War">\n        French and Indian War\n       </a>\n       ), British forces seized Canada from the French, but the\n       <a href="/wiki/French_language" title="French language">\n        francophone\n       </a>\n       population remained politically isolated from the southern colonies. Excluding the\n       <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">\n        Native Americans\n       </a>\n       , who were being conquered and displaced, the 13 British colonies had a population of over 2.1 million in 1770, about one-third that of Britain. Despite continuing new arrivals, the rate of natural increase was such that by the 1770s only a small minority of Americans had been born overseas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-91">\n        <a href="#cite_note-91">\n         [84]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The colonies\' distance from Britain had allowed the development of self-government, but their success motivated monarchs to periodically seek to reassert royal authority.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-92">\n        <a href="#cite_note-92">\n         [85]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In 1774 the\n       <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Navy" title="Spanish Navy">\n        Spanish Navy\n       </a>\n       ship\n       <i>\n        Santiago\n       </i>\n       , under\n       <a href="/wiki/Juan_Jos%C3%A9_P%C3%A9rez_Hern%C3%A1ndez" title="Juan Jos\xc3\xa9 P\xc3\xa9rez Hern\xc3\xa1ndez">\n        Juan P\xc3\xa9rez\n       </a>\n       had entered and anchored in the inlet at\n       <a href="/wiki/Nootka_Sound" title="Nootka Sound">\n        Nootka Sound\n       </a>\n       . Although the Spanish did not land, natives paddled to the ship to trade\n       <a href="/wiki/Fur" title="Fur">\n        furs\n       </a>\n       for\n       <a href="/wiki/Abalone" title="Abalone">\n        abalone\n       </a>\n       shells from\n       <a href="/wiki/California" title="California">\n        California\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-93">\n        <a href="#cite_note-93">\n         [86]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       At the time, the Spanish were able to monopolize the trade between\n       <a href="/wiki/Asia" title="Asia">\n        Asia\n       </a>\n       and North America, granting limited licenses to the\n       <a href="/wiki/Portugal" title="Portugal">\n        Portuguese\n       </a>\n       . When the\n       <a href="/wiki/Russians" title="Russians">\n        Russians\n       </a>\n       began establishing a growing\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fur_trading" title="Fur trading">\n        fur trading\n       </a>\n       system in\n       <a href="/wiki/Alaska" title="Alaska">\n        Alaska\n       </a>\n       the Spanish began to challenge the Russians, with P\xc3\xa9rez\'s voyage being the first of many to the\n       <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Northwest" title="Pacific Northwest">\n        Pacific Northwest\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-94">\n        <a href="#cite_note-94">\n         [87]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-96">\n        <a href="#cite_note-96">\n         [fn 8]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       After having arrived in the Hawaiian islands in 1778, Captain Cook sailed north and then north-east to explore the west coast of North America north of the Spanish settlements in\n       <a href="/wiki/Alta_California" title="Alta California">\n        Alta California\n       </a>\n       . He made landfall on the Oregon coast at approximately 44\xc2\xb030\xe2\x80\xb2 north latitude, naming his landing point\n       <a href="/wiki/Cape_Foulweather" title="Cape Foulweather">\n        Cape Foulweather\n       </a>\n       . Bad weather forced his ships south to about\n       <a href="/wiki/43rd_parallel_north" title="43rd parallel north">\n        43\xc2\xb0 north\n       </a>\n       before they could begin their exploration of the coast northward.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-97">\n        <a href="#cite_note-97">\n         [89]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In March 1778, Cook landed on\n       <a href="/wiki/Bligh_Island_(Canada)" title="Bligh Island (Canada)">\n        Bligh Island\n       </a>\n       and named the inlet "King George\'s Sound". He recorded that the native name was\n       <i>\n        Nutka\n       </i>\n       or Nootka, apparently misunderstanding his conversations at\n       <i>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Yuquot,_British_Columbia" title="Yuquot, British Columbia">\n         Friendly Cove/Yuquot\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       ; his informant may have been explaining that he was on an island (\n       <i>\n        itchme nutka\n       </i>\n       , a place you can "go around"). There may also have been confusion with\n       <i>\n        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nuu-chah-nulth_people" title="Nuu-chah-nulth people">\n         Nuu-chah-nulth\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       , the natives\' autonym (name for themselves). It may also have simply been based on Cook\xe2\x80\x99s mispronunciation of Yuquot, the native name of the place.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-98">\n        <a href="#cite_note-98">\n         [90]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h4>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Effects_on_and_interaction_with_native_populations">\n        Effects on and interaction with native populations\n       </span>\n      </h4>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Indian_Wars" title="American Indian Wars">\n        American Indian Wars\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Population_history_of_indigenous_peoples_of_the_Americas" title="Population history of indigenous peoples of the Americas">\n        Population history of indigenous peoples of the Americas\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/James_Cook" title="James Cook">\n        James Cook\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       With the progress of European colonization in the territories of the contemporary United States, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">\n        Native Americans\n       </a>\n       were often\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Indian_Wars" title="American Indian Wars">\n        conquered and displaced\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Joseph2016_99-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Joseph2016-99">\n         [91]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Population_history_of_indigenous_peoples_of_the_Americas" title="Population history of indigenous peoples of the Americas">\n        native population of America declined\n       </a>\n       after Europeans arrived, and for various reasons, primarily diseases such as\n       <a href="/wiki/Smallpox" title="Smallpox">\n        smallpox\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Measles" title="Measles">\n        measles\n       </a>\n       . Violence was not a significant factor in the overall decline among\n       <a href="/wiki/Indigenous_peoples_of_the_Americas" title="Indigenous peoples of the Americas">\n        Native Americans\n       </a>\n       , though conflict among themselves and with Europeans affected specific tribes and various colonial settlements.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-100">\n        <a href="#cite_note-100">\n         [92]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-101">\n        <a href="#cite_note-101">\n         [93]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Thornton47_102-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Thornton47-102">\n         [94]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-103">\n        <a href="#cite_note-103">\n         [95]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-104">\n        <a href="#cite_note-104">\n         [96]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-105">\n        <a href="#cite_note-105">\n         [97]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In the early days of colonization, many European settlers were subject to food shortages, disease, and attacks from Native Americans. Native Americans were also often at war with neighboring tribes and allied with Europeans in their colonial wars. At the same time, however, many natives and settlers came to depend on each other. Settlers traded for food and animal pelts, natives for guns, ammunition and other European wares.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-106">\n        <a href="#cite_note-106">\n         [98]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Natives taught many settlers where, when and how to cultivate corn, beans and squash.
