href="#cite_note-225">\n         [215]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       American forces in Iraq were\n       <a href="/wiki/Withdrawal_of_U.S._troops_from_Iraq" title="Withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq">\n        withdrawn\n       </a>\n       in large numbers in 2009 and 2010, and the war in the region was declared formally over in December 2011.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-226">\n        <a href="#cite_note-226">\n         [216]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The withdrawal caused\n       <a href="/wiki/Iraqi_insurgency_(2011%E2%80%9313)" title="Iraqi insurgency (2011\xe2\x80\x9313)">\n        an escalation of sectarian insurgency\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-227">\n        <a href="#cite_note-227">\n         [217]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       leading to the rise of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_the_Levant" title="Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant">\n        Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant\n       </a>\n       , the successor of al-Qaeda in the region.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-228">\n        <a href="#cite_note-228">\n         [218]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2014, Obama announced a\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/United_States%E2%80%93Cuban_Thaw" title="United States\xe2\x80\x93Cuban Thaw">\n        restoration\n       </a>\n       of full\n       <a href="/wiki/Cuba%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Cuba\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        diplomatic relations with Cuba\n       </a>\n       for the first time since 1961.\n       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">\n        [\n        <i>\n         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Dates_and_numbers#Chronological_items" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Dates and numbers">\n          <span title="The date of the event predicted near this tag has passed. (June 2017)">\n           needs update\n          </span>\n         </a>\n        </i>\n        ]\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-229">\n        <a href="#cite_note-229">\n         [219]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The next year, the United States as a member of the\n       <a href="/wiki/P5%2B1" title="P5+1">\n        P5+1\n       </a>\n       countries signed the\n       <a href="/wiki/Joint_Comprehensive_Plan_of_Action" title="Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action">\n        Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action\n       </a>\n       , an agreement aimed to slow the development of\n       <a href="/wiki/Nuclear_program_of_Iran" title="Nuclear program of Iran">\n        Iran\'s nuclear program\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-230">\n        <a href="#cite_note-230">\n         [220]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span id="Geography,_climate,_and_environment">\n       </span>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Geography.2C_climate.2C_and_environment">\n        Geography, climate, and environment\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_the_United_States" title="Geography of the United States">\n        Geography of the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Climate_of_the_United_States" title="Climate of the United States">\n        Climate of the United States\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Environment_of_the_United_States" title="Environment of the United States">\n        Environment of the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:USA-satellite.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="675" data-file-width="1082" height="137" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/USA-satellite.jpg/220px-USA-satellite.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/USA-satellite.jpg/330px-USA-satellite.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/USA-satellite.jpg/440px-USA-satellite.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:USA-satellite.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         A composite satellite image of the contiguous United States and surrounding areas\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:US50states_koppen.svg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1071" data-file-width="900" height="262" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b1/US50states_koppen.svg/220px-US50states_koppen.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b1/US50states_koppen.svg/330px-US50states_koppen.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b1/US50states_koppen.svg/440px-US50states_koppen.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:US50states_koppen.svg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6ppen_climate_classification" title="K\xc3\xb6ppen climate classification">\n          K\xc3\xb6ppen climate classifications\n         </a>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The land area of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Contiguous_United_States" title="Contiguous United States">\n        contiguous United States\n       </a>\n       is 2,959,064 square miles (7,663,940.6\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ). Alaska, separated from the contiguous United States by Canada, is the largest state at 663,268 square miles (1,717,856.2\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ).\n       <a href="/wiki/Hawaii" title="Hawaii">\n        Hawaii\n       </a>\n       , occupying an archipelago in the central\n       <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Ocean" title="Pacific Ocean">\n        Pacific\n       </a>\n       , southwest of North America, is 10,931 square miles (28,311\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ) in area. The populated territories of\n       <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Rico" title="Puerto Rico">\n        Puerto Rico\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Samoa" title="American Samoa">\n        American Samoa\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Guam" title="Guam">\n        Guam\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Northern_Mariana_Islands" title="Northern Mariana Islands">\n        Northern Mariana Islands\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Virgin_Islands" title="United States Virgin Islands">\n        U.S. Virgin Islands\n       </a>\n       together cover 9,185 square miles (23,789\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Land_Area_of_US_and_states_231-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Land_Area_of_US_and_states-231">\n         [221]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Measured by only land area, the United States is third in size behind Russia and China, just ahead of Canada.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CIA_Factbook_Area_232-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-CIA_Factbook_Area-232">\n         [222]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The United States is the world\'s third- or fourth-\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_and_dependencies_by_area" title="List of countries and dependencies by area">\n        largest nation by total area\n       </a>\n       (land and water), ranking behind Russia and Canada and just above or below\n       <a href="/wiki/China" title="China">\n        China\n       </a>\n       . The ranking varies depending on how two territories disputed by China and\n       <a href="/wiki/India" title="India">\n        India\n       </a>\n       are counted and how the total size of the United States is measured: calculations range from 3,676,486 square miles (9,522,055.0\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       )\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-233">\n        <a href="#cite_note-233">\n         [223]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       to 3,717,813 square miles (9,629,091.5\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       )\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-234">\n        <a href="#cite_note-234">\n         [224]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       to 3,796,742 square miles (9,833,516.6\xc2\xa0km\n       <sup>\n        2\n       </sup>\n       ).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-WF_235-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-WF-235">\n         [225]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The coastal plain of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Atlantic_Ocean" title="Atlantic Ocean">\n        Atlantic\n       </a>\n       seaboard gives way further inland to\n       <a href="/wiki/Deciduous" title="Deciduous">\n        deciduous\n       </a>\n       forests and the rolling hills of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Piedmont_(United_States)" title="Piedmont (United States)">\n        Piedmont\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-236">\n        <a href="#cite_note-236">\n         [226]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Appalachian_Mountains" title="Appalachian Mountains">\n        Appalachian Mountains\n       </a>\n       divide the eastern seaboard from the\n       <a href="/wiki/Great_Lakes" title="Great Lakes">\n        Great Lakes\n       </a>\n       and the grasslands of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Midwestern_United_States" title="Midwestern United States">\n        Midwest\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NAU_237-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-NAU-237">\n         [227]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Mississippi_River" title="Mississippi River">\n        Mississippi\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x93\n       <a href="/wiki/Missouri_River" title="Missouri River">\n        Missouri River\n       </a>\n       , the world\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_rivers_by_length" title="List of rivers by length">\n        fourth longest river system\n       </a>\n       , runs mainly north\xe2\x80\x93south through the heart of the country. The flat, fertile\n       <a href="/wiki/Prairie" title="Prairie">\n        prairie\n       </a>\n       of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Great_Plains" title="Great Plains">\n        Great Plains\n       </a>\n       stretches to the west, interrupted by\n       <a href="/wiki/U.S._Interior_Highlands" title="U.S. Interior Highlands">\n        a highland region\n       </a>\n       in the southeast.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NAU_237-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-NAU-237">\n         [227]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Rocky_Mountains" title="Rocky Mountains">\n        Rocky Mountains\n       </a>\n       , at the western edge of the Great Plains, extend north to south across the country, reaching altitudes higher than 14,000 feet (4,300\xc2\xa0m) in\n       <a href="/wiki/Colorado" title="Colorado">\n        Colorado\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-238">\n        <a href="#cite_note-238">\n         [228]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Farther west are the rocky\n       <a href="/wiki/Great_Basin" title="Great Basin">\n        Great Basin\n       </a>\n       and deserts such as the\n       <a href="/wiki/Chihuahuan_Desert" title="Chihuahuan Desert">\n        Chihuahua\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Mojave_Desert" title="Mojave Desert">\n        Mojave\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-239">\n        <a href="#cite_note-239">\n         [229]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Sierra_Nevada_(U.S.)" title="Sierra Nevada (U.S.)">\n        Sierra Nevada\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Cascade_Range" title="Cascade Range">\n        Cascade\n       </a>\n       mountain ranges run close to the\n       <a href="/wiki/West_Coast_of_the_United_States" title="West Coast of the United States">\n        Pacific coast\n       </a>\n       , both ranges reaching altitudes higher than 14,000 feet (4,300\xc2\xa0m). The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Extreme_points_of_the_United_States" title="Extreme points of the United States">\n        lowest and highest points\n       </a>\n       in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Contiguous_United_States" title="Contiguous United States">\n        contiguous\n       </a>\n       United States are in the state of\n       <a href="/wiki/California" title="California">\n        California\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-240">\n        <a href="#cite_note-240">\n         [230]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and only about 84 miles (135\xc2\xa0km) apart.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-241">\n        <a href="#cite_note-241">\n         [231]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       At an elevation of 20,310 feet (6,190.5\xc2\xa0m), Alaska\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Denali" title="Denali">\n        Denali\n       </a>\n       (Mount McKinley) is the highest peak in the country and North America.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-242">\n        <a href="#cite_note-242">\n         [232]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Active\n       <a href="/wiki/Volcano" title="Volcano">\n        volcanoes\n       </a>\n       are common throughout Alaska\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Alexander_Archipelago" title="Alexander Archipelago">\n        Alexander\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Aleutian_Islands" title="Aleutian Islands">\n        Aleutian Islands\n       </a>\n       , and Hawaii consists of volcanic islands. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Supervolcano" title="Supervolcano">\n        supervolcano\n       </a>\n       underlying\n       <a href="/wiki/Yellowstone_National_Park" title="Yellowstone National Park">\n        Yellowstone National Park\n       </a>\n       in the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rockies" title="Rockies">\n        Rockies\n       </a>\n       is the continent\'s largest volcanic feature.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-243">\n        <a href="#cite_note-243">\n         [233]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The United States has the most ecoregions out of any country in the world.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-244">\n        <a href="#cite_note-244">\n         [234]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The United States, with its large size and geographic variety, includes most climate types. To the east of the\n       <a href="/wiki/100th_meridian_west" title="100th meridian west">\n        100th meridian\n       </a>\n       , the climate ranges from\n       <a href="/wiki/Humid_continental_climate" title="Humid continental climate">\n        humid continental\n       </a>\n       in the north to\n       <a href="/wiki/Humid_subtropical_climate" title="Humid subtropical climate">\n        humid subtropical\n       </a>\n       in the south.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-245">\n        <a href="#cite_note-245">\n         [235]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The Great Plains west of the 100th meridian are semi-arid. Much of the Western mountains have an\n       <a href="/wiki/Alpine_climate" title="Alpine climate">\n        alpine climate\n       </a>\n       . The climate is arid in the Great Basin, desert in the Southwest,\n       <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">\n        Mediterranean\n       </a>\n       in\n       <a href="/wiki/Coastal_California" title="Coastal California">\n        coastal California\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Oceanic_climate" title="Oceanic climate">\n        oceanic\n       </a>\n       in coastal\n       <a href="/wiki/Oregon" title="Oregon">\n        Oregon\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Washington_(state)" title="Washington (state)">\n        Washington\n       </a>\n       and southern Alaska. Most of Alaska is subarctic or polar. Hawaii and the southern tip of\n       <a href="/wiki/Florida" title="Florida">\n        Florida\n       </a>\n       are tropical, as are the populated territories in the Caribbean and the Pacific.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-246">\n        <a href="#cite_note-246">\n         [236]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Extreme weather is not uncommon\xe2\x80\x94the states bordering the\n       <a href="/wiki/Gulf_of_Mexico" title="Gulf of Mexico">\n        Gulf of Mexico\n       </a>\n       are prone to\n       <a href="/wiki/Tropical_cyclone" title="Tropical cyclone">\n        hurricanes\n       </a>\n       , and most of the world\'s\n       <a href="/wiki/Tornado" title="Tornado">\n        tornadoes\n       </a>\n       occur within the country, mainly in\n       <a href="/wiki/Tornado_Alley" title="Tornado Alley">\n        Tornado Alley\n       </a>\n       areas in the Midwest and South.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-247">\n        <a href="#cite_note-247">\n         [237]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Wildlife">\n        Wildlife\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/Fauna_of_the_United_States" title="Fauna of the United States">\n        Fauna of the United States\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Flora_of_the_United_States" title="Flora of the United States">\n        Flora of the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/Category:Biota_of_the_United_States" title="Category:Biota of the United States">\n        Category:Biota of the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2814" data-file-width="2251" height="213" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg/170px-Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg/255px-Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg/340px-Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg 2x" width="170"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Bald_Eagle_Portrait.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         The\n         <a href="/wiki/Bald_eagle" title="Bald eagle">\n          bald eagle\n         </a>\n         has been the\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/National_bird_of_the_United_States" title="National bird of the United States">\n          national bird\n         </a>\n         of the United States since 1782.\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-McDougall2004_248-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-McDougall2004-248">\n           [238]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The U.S. ecology is\n       <a href="/wiki/Megadiverse_countries" title="Megadiverse countries">\n        megadiverse\n       </a>\n       : about 17,000 species of\n       <a href="/wiki/Vascular_plant" title="Vascular plant">\n        vascular plants\n       </a>\n       occur in the contiguous United States and Alaska, and over 1,800 species of\n       <a href="/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">\n        flowering plants\n       </a>\n       are found in Hawaii, few of which occur on the mainland.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-249">\n        <a href="#cite_note-249">\n         [239]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The United States is home to 428 mammal species, 784 bird species, 311 reptile species, and 295 amphibian species.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Current_Results_.23_of_native_species_in_the_US_250-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Current_Results_.23_of_native_species_in_the_US-250">\n         [240]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       About 91,000 insect species have been described.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-251">\n        <a href="#cite_note-251">\n         [241]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Bald_eagle" title="Bald eagle">\n        bald eagle\n       </a>\n       is both the\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_national_birds" title="List of national birds">\n        national bird\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_national_animals" title="List of national animals">\n        national animal\n       </a>\n       of the United States, and is an enduring symbol of the country itself.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-j23_252-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-j23-252">\n         [242]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       There are 59\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_areas_in_the_United_States_National_Park_System" title="List of areas in the United States National Park System">\n        national parks\n       </a>\n       and hundreds of other federally managed parks, forests, and\n       <a href="/wiki/Wilderness" title="Wilderness">\n        wilderness\n       </a>\n       areas.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-253">\n        <a href="#cite_note-253">\n         [243]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Altogether, the government owns about 28% of the country\'s land area.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYTimes_Federal_Land_254-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-NYTimes_Federal_Land-254">\n         [244]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Most of this is\n       <a href="/wiki/Protected_area" title="Protected area">\n        protected\n       </a>\n       , though some is leased for oil and gas drilling, mining, logging, or cattle ranching; about .86% is used for military purposes.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Federal_Land_Ownership_255-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Federal_Land_Ownership-255">\n         [245]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Fed_Land_Uses_256-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Fed_Land_Uses-256">\n         [246]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Environmental_issues_in_the_United_States" title="Environmental issues in the United States">\n        Environmental issues\n       </a>\n       have been on the national agenda since 1970. Environmental controversies include debates on oil and\n       <a href="/wiki/Nuclear_binding_energy" title="Nuclear binding energy">\n        nuclear energy\n       </a>\n       , dealing with air and water pollution, the economic costs of protecting wildlife, logging and\n       <a href="/wiki/Deforestation" title="Deforestation">\n        deforestation\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-257">\n        <a href="#cite_note-257">\n         [247]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-258">\n        <a href="#cite_note-258">\n         [248]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and international responses to global warming.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-259">\n        <a href="#cite_note-259">\n         [249]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-260">\n        <a href="#cite_note-260">\n         [250]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Many federal and state agencies are involved. The most prominent is the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Environmental_Protection_Agency" title="United States Environmental Protection Agency">\n        Environmental Protection Agency\n       </a>\n       (EPA), created by presidential order in 1970.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Collin2006_261-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Collin2006-261">\n         [251]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The idea of wilderness has shaped the management of public lands since 1964, with the Wilderness Act.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-262">\n        <a href="#cite_note-262">\n         [252]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Endangered_Species_Act" title="Endangered Species Act">\n        Endangered Species Act\n       </a>\n       of 1973 is intended to protect threatened and endangered species and their habitats, which are monitored by the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Fish_and_Wildlife_Service" title="United States Fish and Wildlife Service">\n        United States Fish and Wildlife Service\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Office_263-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Office-263">\n         [253]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Demographics">\n        Demographics\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/Demography_of_the_United_States" title="Demography of the United States">\n        Demography of the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Americans" title="Americans">\n        Americans\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._states_by_population_density" title="List of U.S. states by population density">\n        List of U.S. states by population density\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population" title="List of United States cities by population">\n        List of United States cities by population\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Population">\n        Population\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <table class="toccolours"       </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         25.5%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td   </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1910_United_States_Census" title="1910 United States Census">\n           1910\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         15.0%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         123,202,624\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         16.2%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1940_United_States_Census" title="1940 United States Census">\n           1940\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         14.5%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         179,323,175\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         18.5%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1970_United_States_Census" title="1970 United States Census">\n           1970\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         203,211,926\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td href="/wiki/1980_United_States_Census" title="1980 United States Census">\n           1980\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         226,545,805\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         11.5%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/1990_United_States_Census" title="1990 United States Census">\n           1990\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         248,709,873\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         9.8%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/2000_United_States_Census" title="2000 United States Census">\n           2000\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         281,421,906\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         13.2%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          <a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_Census" title="2010 United States Census">\n           2010\n          </a>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         308,745,538\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         9.7%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-align:center">\n         <b>\n          Est. 2016\n          <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-264">\n           <a href="#cite_note-264">\n            [254]\n           </a>\n          </sup>\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px;">\n         323,127,513\n        </td>\n        <td style="font-size:85%">\n        </td>\n        <td style="padding-left:8px; text-align: center;">\n         4.7%\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td colspan="4" style="border-top:1px solid black; font-size:85%; text-align:left">\n         1610\xe2\x80\x931780 population data.\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-265">\n          <a href="#cite_note-265">\n           [255]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         <br/>\n         Note that the census numbers do\n         <br/>\n         not include\n         <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">\n          Native Americans\n         </a>\n         until 1860.\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Census1860_266-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-Census1860-266">\n           [256]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau" title="United States Census Bureau">\n        U.S. Census Bureau\n       </a>\n       estimated the country\'s population to be 323,425,550 as of April 25, 2016, and to be adding 1 person (net gain) every 13 seconds, or about 6,646 people per day.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-urlPopulation_Clock_11-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-urlPopulation_Clock-11">\n         [8]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The U.S. population almost quadrupled during the 20th century, from about 76 million in 1900.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-267">\n        <a href="#cite_note-267">\n         [257]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The third most populous nation in the world, after\n       <a href="/wiki/China" title="China">\n        China\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/India" title="India">\n        India\n       </a>\n       , the United States is the only major industrialized nation in which large population increases are projected.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PRC_268-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PRC-268">\n         [258]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In the 1800s the average woman had 7.04 children, by the 1900s this number had decreased to 3.56.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Doan_269-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Doan-269">\n         [259]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Since the early 1970s the birth rate has been below the replacement rate of 2.1 with 1.86 children per woman in 2014. Foreign born immigration has caused the US population to continue its rapid increase with the foreign born population doubling from almost 20 million in 1990 to over 40 million in 2010, representing one third of the population increase.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-270">\n        <a href="#cite_note-270">\n         [260]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The foreign born population reached 45 million in 2015.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pewhispanic.org_271-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-pewhispanic.org-271">\n         [261]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-275">\n        <a href="#cite_note-275">\n         [fn 11]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The United States has a birth rate of 13 per 1,000, which is 5 births below the world average.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-276">\n        <a href="#cite_note-276">\n         [265]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Its\n       <a href="/wiki/Population_growth" title="Population growth">\n        population growth\n       </a>\n       rate is positive at 0.7%,\n       <a href="/wiki/Total_fertility_rate#Developed_or_developing_countries" title="Total fertility rate">\n        higher than that of many developed nations\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-277">\n        <a href="#cite_note-277">\n         [266]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In fiscal year 2015, over one million\n       <a href="/wiki/Immigration_to_the_United_States" title="Immigration to the United States">\n        immigrants\n       </a>\n       (most of whom entered through\n       <a href="/wiki/Chain_migration#Legislation_and_chain_migration" title="Chain migration">\n        family reunification\n       </a>\n       ) were granted\n       <a href="/wiki/Permanent_residence_(United_States)" title="Permanent residence (United States)">\n        legal residence\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LPR_278-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-LPR-278">\n         [267]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">\n        Mexico\n       </a>\n       has been the leading source of new residents since the\n       <a href="/wiki/Immigration_and_Nationality_Act_of_1965" title="Immigration and Nationality Act of 1965">\n        1965 Immigration Act\n       </a>\n       . China, India, and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">\n        Philippines\n       </a>\n       have been in the top four sending countries every year since the 1990s.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-279">\n        <a href="#cite_note-279">\n         [268]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       As of 2012\n       <sup class="plainlinks noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;">\n        <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=United_States&amp;action=edit">\n         [update]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       , approximately 11.4 million residents are\n       <a href="/wiki/Illegal_immigration_to_the_United_States" title="Illegal immigration to the United States">\n        illegal immigrants\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-280">\n        <a href="#cite_note-280">\n         [269]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       As of 2015, 47% of all immigrants are Hispanic, 26% are Asian, 18% are white and 8% are black. The percentage of immigrants who are Asian is increasing while the percentage who are Hispanic is decreasing.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pewhispanic.org_271-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-pewhispanic.org-271">\n         [261]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Minority_group" title="Minority group">\n        Minorities\n       </a>\n       (as defined by the Census Bureau as all those beside non-Hispanic, non-multiracial\n       <a href="/wiki/Non-Hispanic_whites" title="Non-Hispanic whites">\n        whites\n       </a>\n       ) constituted 37.2% of the population in 2012\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-:0_281-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-:0-281">\n         [270]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and over 50% of children under age one,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pewcensus_282-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-pewcensus-282">\n         [271]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-283">\n        <a href="#cite_note-283">\n         [272]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and are projected to constitute the majority by 2044.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pewcensus_282-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-pewcensus-282">\n         [271]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       According to a survey conducted by the Williams Institute, nine million Americans, or roughly 3.4% of the adult population identify themselves as\n       <a href="/wiki/Homosexuality" title="Homosexuality">\n        homosexual\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Bisexuality" title="Bisexuality">\n        bisexual\n       </a>\n       , or\n       <a href="/wiki/Transgender" title="Transgender">\n        transgender\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-284">\n        <a href="#cite_note-284">\n         [273]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-285">\n        <a href="#cite_note-285">\n         [274]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       A 2016\n       <a href="/wiki/Gallup_(company)" title="Gallup (company)">\n        Gallup\n       </a>\n       poll also concluded that 4.1% of adult Americans identified as\n       <a href="/wiki/LGBT" title="LGBT">\n        LGBT\n       </a>\n       . The highest percentage came from the District of Columbia (10%), while the lowest state was North Dakota at 1.7%.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-286">\n        <a href="#cite_note-286">\n         [275]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In a 2013 survey, the\n       <a href="/wiki/Centers_for_Disease_Control_and_Prevention" title="Centers for Disease Control and Prevention">\n        Centers for Disease Control and Prevention\n       </a>\n       found that 96.6% of Americans identify as straight, while 1.6% identify as gay or lesbian, and 0.7% identify as being bisexual.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-287">\n        <a href="#cite_note-287">\n         [276]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In 2010, the U.S. population included an estimated 5.2 million people with some\n       <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">\n        American Indian\n       </a>\n       or\n       <a href="/wiki/Alaska_Natives" title="Alaska Natives">\n        Alaska Native\n       </a>\n       ancestry (2.9 million exclusively of such ancestry) and 1.2 million with some\n       <a href="/wiki/Native_Hawaiians" title="Native Hawaiians">\n        native Hawaiian\n       </a>\n       or\n       <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Islander" title="Pacific Islander">\n        Pacific island\n       </a>\n       ancestry (0.5 million exclusively).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Cen2010Race_288-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Cen2010Race-288">\n         [277]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The census counted more than 19 million people of "Some Other Race" who were "unable to identify with any" of its five official race categories in 2010, over 18.5 million (97%) of whom are of Hispanic ethnicity.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Cen2010Race_288-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Cen2010Race-288">\n         [277]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The population growth of\n       <a href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans" title="Hispanic and Latino Americans">\n        Hispanic and Latino Americans\n       </a>\n       (the terms are officially interchangeable) is a major\n       <a href="/wiki/Demographic_transition" title="Demographic transition">\n        demographic trend\n       </a>\n       . The 50.5 million Americans of Hispanic descent\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Cen2010Race_288-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Cen2010Race-288">\n         [277]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       are identified as sharing a distinct "\n       <a href="/wiki/Race_and_ethnicity_in_the_United_States_Census" title="Race and ethnicity in the United States Census">\n        ethnicity\n       </a>\n       " by the Census Bureau; 64% of Hispanic Americans are of\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mexican_American" title="Mexican American">\n        Mexican descent\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CB2007_289-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-CB2007-289">\n         [278]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Between 2000 and 2010, the country\'s Hispanic population increased 43% while the non-Hispanic population rose just 4.9%.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Cen2010Summary_290-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Cen2010Summary-290">\n         [279]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Much of this growth is from immigration; in 2007, 12.6% of the U.S. population was\n       <a href="/wiki/Foreign_born" title="Foreign born">\n        foreign-born\n       </a>\n       , with 54% of that figure born in\n       <a href="/wiki/Latin_America" title="Latin America">\n        Latin America\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-291">\n        <a href="#cite_note-291">\n         [280]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-297">\n        <a href="#cite_note-297">\n         [fn 12]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       About 82% of Americans live in\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_urban_area" title="United States urban area">\n        urban areas\n       </a>\n       (including suburbs);\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-WF_235-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-WF-235">\n         [225]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       about half of those reside in cities with populations over 50,000.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-298">\n        <a href="#cite_note-298">\n         [286]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The US has numerous clusters of cities known as megaregions, the largest being the\n       <a href="/wiki/Great_Lakes_Megalopolis" title="Great Lakes Megalopolis">\n        Great Lakes Megalopolis\n       </a>\n       followed by the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Northeast_Megalopolis" title="Northeast Megalopolis">\n        Northeast Megalopolis\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_California" title="Southern California">\n        Southern California\n       </a>\n       . In 2008, 273\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population" title="List of United States cities by population">\n        incorporated municipalities\n       </a>\n       had populations over 100,000, nine cities had more than one million residents, and four\n       <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">\n        global cities\n       </a>\n       had over two million (\n       <a href="/wiki/New_York_City" title="New York City">\n        New York\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles" title="Los Angeles">\n        Los Angeles\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Chicago" title="Chicago">\n        Chicago\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Houston" title="Houston">\n        Houston\n       </a>\n       ).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopEstBigCities_299-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PopEstBigCities-299">\n         [287]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       There are 52\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_Metropolitan_Statistical_Areas" title="List of Metropolitan Statistical Areas">\n        metropolitan areas\n       </a>\n       with populations greater than one million.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopEstMSA_300-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PopEstMSA-300">\n         [288]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Of the 50 fastest-growing metro areas, 47 are in the West or South.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-301">\n        <a href="#cite_note-301">\n         [289]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The metro areas of\n       <a href="/wiki/San_Bernardino,_California" title="San Bernardino, California">\n        San Bernardino\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Dallas" title="Dallas">\n        Dallas\n       </a>\n       , Houston,\n       <a href="/wiki/Atlanta" title="Atlanta">\n        Atlanta\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Phoenix,_Arizona" title="Phoenix, Arizona">\n        Phoenix\n       </a>\n       all grew by more than a million people between 2000 and 2008.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopEstMSA_300-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PopEstMSA-300">\n         [288]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <span id="Population_centers">\n       </span>\n      </p>\n      <div style="margin:0 auto">\n       <table class="infobox" style="text-align:center; width:97%; margin-right:10px; font-size:90%">\n        <tr>\n         <th colspan="5" style="padding:0.3em 0; line-height:1.2em; background:#ccc;">\n          Leading population centers (\n          <a href="/wiki/List_of_Metropolitan_Statistical_Areas" title="List of Metropolitan Statistical Areas">\n           see complete list\n          </a>\n          )\n Angeles\xe2\x80\x93Long Beach\xe2\x80\x93Anaheim, CA MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Western_United_States" title="Western         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Washington_metropolitan_area" title="Washington metropolitan area">\n           Washington, DC\xe2\x80\x93VA\xe2\x80\x93MD\xe2\x80\x93WV MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n           South\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align: center;">\n          7\n         </td>\n         <td Philadelphia\xe2\x80\x93Camden\xe2\x80\x93Wilmington, PA\xe2\x80\x93NJ\xe2\x80\x93DE\xe2\x80\x93MD MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a         Miami\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          6,066,387\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Miami_metropolitan_area" title="Miami metropolitan area">\n           Miami\xe2\x80\x93Fort Lauderdale\xe2\x80\x93West Palm Beach, FL MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n           South\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align: center;">\n          9\n         </td>\n         <td style="text-align: left; padding-left: 10px;">\n          <b>\n           <a href="/wiki/Atlanta" title="Atlanta">\n            Atlanta\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          5,789,700\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/Atlanta_metropolitan_area" title="Atlanta metropolitan area">\n           Atlanta\xe2\x80\x93Sandy Springs\xe2\x80\x93Roswell, GA MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n           South\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align: center;">\n          10\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed; text-align: left; padding-left: 10px;">\n          <b>\n           <a href="/wiki/Boston" title="Boston">\n            Boston\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          4,794,447\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Greater_Boston" title="Greater Boston">\n           Boston\xe2\x80\x93Cambridge\xe2\x80\x93Quincy, MA\xe2\x80\x93NH MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Northeastern_United_States" title="Northeastern United States">\n           Northeast\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align: center;">\n          11\n         </td>\n         <td style="text-align: left; padding-left: 10px;">\n          <b>\n           <a href="/wiki/San_Francisco" title="San Francisco">\n            San Francisco\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          4,679,166\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/San_Francisco%E2%80%93Oakland%E2%80%93Hayward,_CA_Metropolitan_Statistical_Area" title="San Francisco\xe2\x80\x93Oakland\xe2\x80\x93Hayward, CA Metropolitan Statistical Area">\n           San Francisco\xe2\x80\x93Oakland\xe2\x80\x93Fremont, CA MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/Western_United_States" title="Western United States">\n           West\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align: center;">\n          12\n         </td>\n         <td  </b>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          4,661,537\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Phoenix_metropolitan_area" title="Phoenix metropolitan area">\n           Phoenix\xe2\x80\x93Mesa\xe2\x80\x93Chandler, AZ MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a Riverside\xe2\x80\x93San Bernardino\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          4,527,837\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/Inland_Empire"         </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align: center;">\n          16\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed; Paul\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          3,551,036\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a  </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Midwestern_United_States" title="Midwestern United States">\n           Midwest\n          </a>\n         </td>\n href="/wiki/San_Diego_County,_California" title="San Diego County, California">\n           San Diego\xe2\x80\x93Carlsbad\xe2\x80\x93San Marcos, CA MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/Western_United_States" title="Western United States">\n           West\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; title="Tampa Bay Area">\n            Tampa\xe2\x80\x93St. Petersburg\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          3,032,171\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Tampa_Bay_Area" title="Tampa Bay Area">\n           Tampa\xe2\x80\x93St. Petersburg\xe2\x80\x93Clearwater, FL MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n           South\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align: center;">\n          19\n         </td>\n         <td style="text-align: left; padding-left: 10px;">\n          <b>\n           <a href="/wiki/Denver" title="Denver">\n            Denver\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          2,853,077\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/Denver_metropolitan_area" title="Denver metropolitan area">\n           Denver\xe2\x80\x93Aurora\xe2\x80\x93Lakewood, CO MSA\n          </a>\n         </td>\n         <td>\n          <a href="/wiki/Western_United_States" title="Western United States">\n           West\n          </a>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td style="background:#f0f0f0; text-align:      St. Louis\n           </a>\n          </b>\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          2,807,002\n         </td>\n         <td style="background:#ededed;">\n          <a style="background:#f5f5f5; text-align: center;">\n          Based on 2015 population estimates from the\n          <a href="/wiki/United_States_Census_Bureau" title="United States Census Bureau">\n           U.S. Census Bureau\n          </a>\n          <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-303">\n           <a href="#cite_note-303">\n            [291]\n           </a>\n          </sup>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n       </table>\n      </div>\n      <div style="clear:both;">\n      </div>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Language">\n        Language\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_the_United_States" title="Languages of the United States">\n        Languages of the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/Language_Spoken_at_Home_in_the_United_States_of_America" title="Language Spoken at Home in the United States of America">\n        Language Spoken at Home in the United States of America\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_endangered_languages_in_the_United_States" title="List of endangered languages in the United States">\n        List of endangered languages in the United States\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Language_education_in_the_United_States" title="Language education in the United States">\n        Language education in the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/English_language" title="English language">\n        English\n       </a>\n       (\n       <a href="/wiki/American_English" title="American English">\n        American English\n       </a>\n       ) is the\n       <a href="/wiki/De_facto" title="De facto">\n        de facto\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/National_language" title="National language">\n        national language\n       </a>\n       . Although there is no\n       <a href="/wiki/Official_language" title="Official language">\n        official language\n       </a>\n       at the federal level, some laws\xe2\x80\x94such as\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Naturalized_citizen_of_the_United_States" title="Naturalized citizen of the United States">\n        U.S. naturalization requirements\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94standardize English. In 2010, about 230 million, or 80% of the population aged five years and older, spoke only English at home.\n       <a href="/wiki/Spanish_language_in_the_United_States" title="Spanish language in the United States">\n        Spanish\n       </a>\n       , spoken by 12% of the population at home, is the second most common language and the most widely taught second language.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Lang_304-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Lang-304">\n         [292]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-305">\n        <a href="#cite_note-305">\n         [293]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Some Americans advocate making English the country\'s official language, as it is in 32 states.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ILW_306-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-ILW-306">\n         [294]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Both\n       <a href="/wiki/Hawaiian_language" title="Hawaiian language">\n        Hawaiian\n       </a>\n       and English are official languages in\n       <a href="/wiki/Hawaii" title="Hawaii">\n        Hawaii\n       </a>\n       , by state law.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-307">\n        <a href="#cite_note-307">\n         [295]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Alaska" title="Alaska">\n        Alaska\n       </a>\n       recognizes\n       <a href="/wiki/Alaska_Native_languages" title="Alaska Native languages">\n        twenty Native languages\n       </a>\n       as well as English.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-308">\n        <a href="#cite_note-308">\n         [296]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       While neither has an official language,\n       <a href="/wiki/New_Mexico" title="New Mexico">\n        New Mexico\n       </a>\n       has laws providing for the use of both English and Spanish, as\n       <a href="/wiki/Louisiana" title="Louisiana">\n        Louisiana\n       </a>\n       does for English and\n       <a href="/wiki/French_language_in_the_United_States" title="French language in the United States">\n        French\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-309">\n        <a href="#cite_note-309">\n         [297]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Other states, such as\n       <a href="/wiki/California" title="California">\n        California\n       </a>\n       , mandate the publication of Spanish versions of certain government documents including court forms.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-310">\n        <a href="#cite_note-310">\n         [298]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Several insular territories grant official recognition to their native languages, along with English:\n       <a href="/wiki/Samoan_language" title="Samoan language">\n        Samoan\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-311">\n        <a href="#cite_note-311">\n         [299]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Chamorro_language" title="Chamorro language">\n        Chamorro\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-312">\n        <a href="#cite_note-312">\n         [300]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       are recognized by\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Samoa" title="American Samoa">\n        American Samoa\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Guam" title="Guam">\n        Guam\n       </a>\n       , respectively;\n       <a href="/wiki/Carolinian_language" title="Carolinian language">\n        Carolinian\n       </a>\n       and Chamorro are recognized by the\n       <a href="/wiki/Northern_Mariana_Islands" title="Northern Mariana Islands">\n        Northern Mariana Islands\n       </a>\n       ;\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-313">\n        <a href="#cite_note-313">\n         [301]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Spanish is an official language of\n       <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Rico" title="Puerto Rico">\n        Puerto Rico\n       </a>\n       and is more widely spoken than English there.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PuertoRicoTranslation_314-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-PuertoRicoTranslation-314">\n         [302]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_most_commonly_learned_foreign_languages_in_the_United_States" title="List of most commonly learned foreign languages in the United States">\n        most widely taught foreign languages\n       </a>\n       in the United States, in terms of enrollment numbers from kindergarten through university undergraduate studies, are: Spanish (around 7.2 million students), French (1.5 million), and\n       <a href="/wiki/German_language_in_the_United_States" title="German language in the United States">\n        German\n       </a>\n       (500,000). Other commonly taught languages (with 100,000 to 250,000 learners) include\n       <a href="/wiki/Latin" title="Latin">\n        Latin\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Japanese_language_education_in_the_United_States" title="Japanese language education in the United States">\n        Japanese\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Sign_Language" title="American Sign Language">\n        ASL\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Italian_language_in_the_United_States" title="Italian language in the United States">\n        Italian\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_language_in_the_United_States" title="Chinese language in the United States">\n        Chinese\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-315">\n        <a href="#cite_note-315">\n         [303]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-316">\n        <a href="#cite_note-316">\n         [304]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       18% of all Americans claim to speak at least one language in addition to English.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-317">\n        <a href="#cite_note-317">\n         [305]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="float:center; margin-left:1em; font-size: 90%">\n       <caption>\n        Languages spoken at home by more than 1 million persons in the U.S. (2016)\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MLA_Data_318-0">\n         <a href="#cite_note-MLA_Data-318">\n          [306]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-319">\n         <a href="#cite_note-319">\n          [307]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-320">\n         <a href="#cite_note-320">\n          [fn 13]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n       </caption>\n       <tr>\n       </td>\n        <td>\n         13%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         40,489,813\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         23,899,421\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         16,590,392\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Chinese_language" title="Chinese language">\n          Chinese\n         </a>\n         <br/>\n         <small>\n          (all varieties, including\n          <a href="/wiki/Mandarin_Chinese" title="Mandarin Chinese">\n           Mandarin\n          </a>\n          and\n          <a href="/wiki/Cantonese" title="Cantonese">\n           Cantonese\n          </a>\n          )\n         </small>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1.0%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         3,372,930\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1,518,619\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1,854,311\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Tagalog_language" title="Tagalog language">\n          Tagalog\n         </a>\n         <br/>\n         <small>\n          (including\n          <a href="/wiki/Filipino_language" title="Filipino language">\n           Filipino\n          </a>\n          )\n         </small>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.5%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1,701,960\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1,159,211\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         542,749\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Vietnamese_language" title="Vietnamese language">\n          Vietnamese\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.4%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1,509,993\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         634,273\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         875,720\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Arabic_language" title="Arabic language">\n          Arabic\n         </a>\n         <br/>\n         <small>\n          (all varieties)\n         </small>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.3%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1,231,098\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         770,882\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         460,216\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/French_language" title="French language">\n          French\n         </a>\n         <br/>\n
