1,216,668\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         965,584\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         251,087\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Korean_language" title="Korean language">\n          Korean\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         0.2%\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         1,088,788\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         505,734\n        </td>\n        <td>\n         583,054\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Religion">\n        Religion\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Religion_in_the_United_States" title="Religion in the United States">\n        Religion in the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       See also:\n       <a href="/wiki/History_of_religion_in_the_United_States" title="History of religion in the United States">\n        History of religion in the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Freedom_of_religion_in_the_United_States" title="Freedom of religion in the United States">\n        Freedom of religion in the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Separation_of_church_and_state_in_the_United_States" title="Separation of church and state in the United States">\n        Separation of church and state in the United States\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_religious_movements_that_began_in_the_United_States" title="List of religious movements that began in the United States">\n        List of religious movements that began in the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <table class="wikitable sortable floatright" style="font-size: 90%">\n       <caption style="font-size:100%">\n        Religious affiliation in the U.S. (2014)\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pew2015_10-1">\n         <a href="#cite_note-pew2015-10">\n          [7]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n       </caption>\n       <tr>\n        <th>\n         Affiliation\n        </th>\n        <th colspan="2">\n         % of U.S. population\n        </th>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Christianity" title="Christianity">\n          Christian\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          70.6\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          70.6\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:141.2px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:darkblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Protestant" title="Protestant">\n          Protestant\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          46.5\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          46.5\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:93px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:mediumblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:30px;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Evangelicalism_in_the_United_States" title="Evangelicalism in the United States">\n          Evangelical Protestant\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          25.4\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          25.4\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:50.8px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:30px;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Mainline_Protestant" title="Mainline Protestant">\n          Mainline Protestant\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          14.7\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          14.7\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:29.4px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:30px;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Black_church" title="Black church">\n          Black church\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          6.5\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          6.5\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:13px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Catholic" title="Catholic">\n          Catholic\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          20.8\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          20.8\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:41.6px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:mediumblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mormon" title="Mormon">\n          Mormon\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          1.6\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          1.6\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:3.2px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:mediumblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Jehovah%27s_Witnesses" title="Jehovah\'s Witnesses">\n          Jehovah\'s Witnesses\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          0.8\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          0.8\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:1.6px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:mediumblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox" title="Eastern Orthodox">\n          Eastern Orthodox\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          0.5\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          0.5\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:1px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:mediumblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         Other Christian\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          0.4\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          0.4\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:0.8px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:mediumblue">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jewish" title="Jewish">\n          Jewish\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          1.9\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          1.9\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:3.8px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightgreen">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Muslim" title="Muslim">\n          Muslim\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          0.9\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          0.9\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:1.8px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightgreen">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Buddhist" title="Buddhist">\n          Buddhist\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          0.7\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          0.7\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:1.4px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightgreen">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Hindu" title="Hindu">\n          Hindu\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          0.7\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          0.7\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:1.4px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightgreen">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         Other faiths\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          1.8\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          1.8\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:3.6px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:lightgreen">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         <a href="/wiki/Irreligion" title="Irreligion">\n          Irreligious\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          22.8\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          22.8\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:45.6px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:purple">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         Nothing in particular\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          15.8\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          15.8\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:31.6px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:#A020F0">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Agnosticism" title="Agnosticism">\n          Agnostic\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          4.0\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          4\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:8px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:#A020F0">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td style="text-indent:15px;">\n         <a href="/wiki/Atheism" title="Atheism">\n          Atheist\n         </a>\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          3.1\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          3.1\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:6.2px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:#A020F0">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n       <tr>\n        <td>\n         Don\'t know or refused answer\n        </td>\n        <td align="right">\n         <b>\n          0.6\n         </b>\n        </td>\n        <td align="left">\n         <span style="display:none;">\n          0.6\n         </span>\n         <div style="width:1.2px;height:2ex;background:#aaa;background:#A020F0">\n         </div>\n        </td>\n       </tr>\n      </table>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/First_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution" title="First Amendment to the United States Constitution">\n        First Amendment\n       </a>\n       of the U.S. Constitution guarantees the\n       <a href="/wiki/Free_Exercise_Clause" title="Free Exercise Clause">\n        free exercise\n       </a>\n       of religion and forbids Congress from passing laws respecting its\n       <a href="/wiki/Establishment_Clause" title="Establishment Clause">\n        establishment\n       </a>\n       .\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Christianity" title="Christianity">\n        Christianity\n       </a>\n       is by far the most common religion practiced in the U.S., but other religions are followed, too. In a 2013 survey, 56% of Americans said that religion played a "very important role in their lives", a far higher figure than that of any other wealthy nation.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-321">\n        <a href="#cite_note-321">\n         [308]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In a 2009 Gallup poll, 42% of Americans said that they attended church weekly or almost weekly; the figures ranged from a low of 23% in\n       <a href="/wiki/Vermont" title="Vermont">\n        Vermont\n       </a>\n       to a high of 63% in Mississippi.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-gallup.com_322-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-gallup.com-322">\n         [309]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Experts, researchers and authors have referred to the United States as a "Protestant nation" or "founded on Protestant principles,"\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-323">\n        <a href="#cite_note-323">\n         [310]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-324">\n        <a href="#cite_note-324">\n         [311]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-325">\n        <a href="#cite_note-325">\n         [312]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-326">\n        <a href="#cite_note-326">\n         [313]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       specifically emphasizing its\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Calvinist" title="Calvinist">\n        Calvinist\n       </a>\n       heritage.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-327">\n        <a href="#cite_note-327">\n         [314]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-328">\n        <a href="#cite_note-328">\n         [315]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-329">\n        <a href="#cite_note-329">\n         [316]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       As with other Western countries, the U.S. is becoming less religious.\n       <a href="/wiki/Irreligion" title="Irreligion">\n        Irreligion\n       </a>\n       is growing rapidly among Americans under 30.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-330">\n        <a href="#cite_note-330">\n         [317]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Polls show that overall American confidence in organized religion has been declining since the mid to late 1980s,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-331">\n        <a href="#cite_note-331">\n         [318]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and that younger Americans in particular are becoming increasingly irreligious.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pew2015_10-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-pew2015-10">\n         [7]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-332">\n        <a href="#cite_note-332">\n         [319]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       According to a 2012 study, the Protestant share of the U.S. population had dropped to 48%, thus ending its status as religious category of the majority for the first time.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Nones_of_the_Rise_333-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Nones_of_the_Rise-333">\n         [320]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-334">\n        <a href="#cite_note-334">\n         [321]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Americans with no religion have 1.7 children compared to 2.2 among Christians. The unaffiliated are less likely to get married with 37% marrying compared to 52% of Christians.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-335">\n        <a href="#cite_note-335">\n         [322]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       According to a 2014 survey, 70.6% of adults identified themselves as\n       <a href="/wiki/Christianity_in_the_United_States" title="Christianity in the United States">\n        Christian\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-336">\n        <a href="#cite_note-336">\n         [323]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Protestantism" title="Protestantism">\n        Protestant\n       </a>\n       denominations accounted for 46.5%, while\n       <a href="/wiki/Catholic_Church_in_the_United_States" title="Catholic Church in the United States">\n        Roman Catholicism\n       </a>\n       , at 20.8%, was the largest individual denomination.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Pew_337-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Pew-337">\n         [324]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The total reporting non-Christian religions in 2014 was 5.9%.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Pew_337-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Pew-337">\n         [324]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Other religions include\n       <a href="/wiki/American_Jews" title="American Jews">\n        Judaism\n       </a>\n       (1.9%),\n       <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_the_United_States" title="Islam in the United States">\n        Islam\n       </a>\n       (0.9%),\n       <a href="/wiki/Buddhism_in_the_United_States" title="Buddhism in the United States">\n        Buddhism\n       </a>\n       (0.7%),\n       <a href="/wiki/Hinduism_in_the_United_States" title="Hinduism in the United States">\n        Hinduism\n       </a>\n       (0.7%).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Pew_337-2">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Pew-337">\n         [324]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The survey also reported that 22.8% of Americans described themselves as\n       <a href="/wiki/Agnosticism" title="Agnosticism">\n        agnostic\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Atheism" title="Atheism">\n        atheist\n       </a>\n       or simply having\n       <a href="/wiki/Irreligion" title="Irreligion">\n        no religion\n       </a>\n       , up from 8.2% in 1990.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Pew_337-3">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Pew-337">\n         [324]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ARIS_338-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-ARIS-338">\n         [325]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-The_Future_of_the_Global_Muslim_Population_339-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-The_Future_of_the_Global_Muslim_Population-339">\n         [326]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       There are also\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Unitarian_Universalist" title="Unitarian Universalist">\n        Unitarian Universalist\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Bah%C3%A1%27%C3%AD_Faith" title="Bah\xc3\xa1\'\xc3\xad Faith">\n        Baha\'i\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Sikh" title="Sikh">\n        Sikh\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Jainism" title="Jainism">\n        Jain\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Shinto" title="Shinto">\n        Shinto\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Confucianism" title="Confucianism">\n        Confucian\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Taoism" title="Taoism">\n        Taoist\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Neo-Druidism" title="Neo-Druidism">\n        Druid\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Native_American_religion" title="Native American religion">\n        Native American\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Wicca" title="Wicca">\n        Wiccan\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Religious_humanism" title="Religious humanism">\n        humanist\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Deism" title="Deism">\n        deist\n       </a>\n       communities.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-340">\n        <a href="#cite_note-340">\n         [327]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Protestantism_in_the_United_States" title="Protestantism in the United States">\n        Protestantism\n       </a>\n       is the largest Christian religious grouping in the United States. Baptists collectively form the largest branch of Protestantism, and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_Baptist_Convention" title="Southern Baptist Convention">\n        Southern Baptist Convention\n       </a>\n       is the largest individual Protestant denomination.\n       <a href="/wiki/Catholic_Church_in_the_United_States" title="Catholic Church in the United States">\n        Roman Catholicism\n       </a>\n       in the United States has its origin primarily in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Spanish_colonization_of_the_Americas" title="Spanish colonization of the Americas">\n        Spanish\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/French_colonization_of_the_Americas" title="French colonization of the Americas">\n        French\n       </a>\n       colonization of the Americas and, in part, in the English Catholic Proprietary of Maryland,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-341">\n        <a href="#cite_note-341">\n         [328]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       It later grew because of Irish, Italian, Polish, German and Hispanic immigration.\n       <a href="/wiki/Rhode_Island" title="Rhode Island">\n        Rhode Island\n       </a>\n       has the highest percentage of Catholics with 40 percent of the total population.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-342">\n        <a href="#cite_note-342">\n         [329]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Lutheranism" title="Lutheranism">\n        Lutheranism\n       </a>\n       in the U.S. has its origin in immigration from\n       <a href="/wiki/Northern_Europe" title="Northern Europe">\n        Northern Europe\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Germany" title="Germany">\n        Germany\n       </a>\n       .\n       <a href="/wiki/North_Dakota" title="North Dakota">\n        North\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/South_Dakota" title="South Dakota">\n        South Dakota\n       </a>\n       are the only states in which a plurality of the population is Lutheran.\n       <a href="/wiki/Presbyterianism" title="Presbyterianism">\n        Presbyterianism\n       </a>\n       was introduced in North America by\n       <a href="/wiki/Scottish_people" title="Scottish people">\n        Scottish\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Ulster_Scots_people" title="Ulster Scots people">\n        Ulster Scots\n       </a>\n       immigrants. Although it has spread across the United States, it is heavily concentrated on the East Coast.\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dutch_Reformed" title="Dutch Reformed">\n        Dutch Reformed\n       </a>\n       congregations were founded first in\n       <a href="/wiki/New_Amsterdam" title="New Amsterdam">\n        New Amsterdam\n       </a>\n       (New York City) before spreading westward.\n       <a href="/wiki/Utah" title="Utah">\n        Utah\n       </a>\n       is the only state where\n       <a href="/wiki/Mormonism" title="Mormonism">\n        Mormonism\n       </a>\n       is the religion of the majority of the population. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Mormon_Corridor" title="Mormon Corridor">\n        Mormon Corridor\n       </a>\n       also extends to parts of\n       <a href="/wiki/Idaho" title="Idaho">\n        Idaho\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Nevada" title="Nevada">\n        Nevada\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Wyoming" title="Wyoming">\n        Wyoming\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Walsh2005_343-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Walsh2005-343">\n         [330]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Bible_Belt" title="Bible Belt">\n        Bible Belt\n       </a>\n       is an informal term for a region in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Southern_United_States" title="Southern United States">\n        Southern United States\n       </a>\n       in which socially conservative Evangelical Protestantism is a significant part of the culture and Christian church attendance across the denominations is generally higher than the nation\'s average. By contrast, religion plays the least important role in\n       <a href="/wiki/New_England" title="New England">\n        New England\n       </a>\n       and in the\n       <a href="/wiki/Western_United_States" title="Western United States">\n        Western United States\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-gallup.com_322-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-gallup.com-322">\n         [309]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Family_structure">\n        Family structure\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main article:\n       <a href="/wiki/Family_structure_in_the_United_States" title="Family structure in the United States">\n        Family structure in the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       As of 2007\n       <sup class="plainlinks noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;">\n        <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=United_States&amp;action=edit">\n         [update]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       , 58% of Americans age 18 and over were married, 6% were widowed, 10% were divorced, and 25% had never been married.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-344">\n        <a href="#cite_note-344">\n         [331]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Women now work mostly outside the home and receive a majority of\n       <a href="/wiki/Educational_attainment_in_the_United_States" title="Educational attainment in the United States">\n        bachelor\'s degrees\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-345">\n        <a href="#cite_note-345">\n         [332]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The U.S.\n       <a href="/wiki/Teenage_pregnancy" title="Teenage pregnancy">\n        teenage pregnancy\n       </a>\n       rate is 26.5 per 1,000 women. The rate has declined by 57% since 1991.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-tbirthrate_346-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-tbirthrate-346">\n         [333]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2013, the highest teenage birth rate was in\n       <a href="/wiki/Alabama" title="Alabama">\n        Alabama\n       </a>\n       , and the lowest in\n       <a href="/wiki/Wyoming" title="Wyoming">\n        Wyoming\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-tbirthrate_346-1">\n        <a href="#cite_note-tbirthrate-346">\n         [333]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-347">\n        <a href="#cite_note-347">\n         [334]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Abortion_in_the_United_States" title="Abortion in the United States">\n        Abortion\n       </a>\n       is legal throughout the U.S., owing to\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Roe_v._Wade" title="Roe v. Wade">\n         Roe v. Wade\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       , a 1973\n       <a href="/wiki/Lists_of_landmark_court_decisions" title="Lists of landmark court decisions">\n        landmark decision\n       </a>\n       by the\n       <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States" title="Supreme Court of the United States">\n        Supreme Court of the United States\n       </a>\n       . While the abortion rate is falling, the abortion ratio of 241 per 1,000 live births and abortion rate of 15 per 1,000 women aged 15\xe2\x80\x9344 remain higher than those of most Western nations.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-348">\n        <a href="#cite_note-348">\n         [335]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2013, the average age at first birth was 26 and 40.6% of births were to unmarried women.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-349">\n        <a href="#cite_note-349">\n         [336]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Total_fertility_rate" title="Total fertility rate">\n        total fertility rate\n       </a>\n       (TFR) was estimated for 2013 at 1.86 births per woman.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-350">\n        <a href="#cite_note-350">\n         [337]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Adoption_in_the_United_States" title="Adoption in the United States">\n        Adoption in the United States\n       </a>\n       is common and relatively easy from a legal point of view (compared to other Western countries).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-351">\n        <a href="#cite_note-351">\n         [338]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In 2001, with over 127,000 adoptions, the U.S. accounted for nearly half of the total number of adoptions worldwide.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-352">\n        <a href="#cite_note-352">\n         [339]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_the_United_States" title="Same-sex marriage in the United States">\n        Same-sex marriage\n       </a>\n       is legal nationwide and it is legal for same-sex\n       <a href="/wiki/LGBT_adoption_in_the_United_States" title="LGBT adoption in the United States">\n        couples to adopt.\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Polygamy" title="Polygamy">\n        Polygamy\n       </a>\n       is illegal throughout the U.S.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-quietly_353-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-quietly-353">\n         [340]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h2>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Government_and_politics">\n        Government and politics\n       </span>\n      </h2>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/Federal_government_of_the_United_States" title="Federal government of the United States">\n        Federal government of the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/State_governments_of_the_United_States" title="State governments of the United States">\n        State governments of the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Local_government_in_the_United_States" title="Local government in the United States">\n        Local government in the United States\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Elections_in_the_United_States" title="Elections in the United States">\n        Elections in the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tmulti tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:204px;max-width:204px">\n        <div class="tsingle" style="margin:1px;width:202px;max-width:202px">\n         <div class="thumbimage">\n          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Capitol_Building_Full_View.jpg">\n           <img alt="" data-file-height="3072" data-file-width="7168" height="86" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Capitol_Building_Full_View.jpg/200px-Capitol_Building_Full_View.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Capitol_Building_Full_View.jpg/300px-Capitol_Building_Full_View.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Capitol_Building_Full_View.jpg/400px-Capitol_Building_Full_View.jpg 2x" width="200"/>\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left;text-align:center">\n          The\n          <a href="/wiki/United_States_Capitol" title="United States Capitol">\n           United States Capitol\n          </a>\n          ,\n          <br/>\n          where\n          <a href="/wiki/United_States_Congress" title="United States Congress">\n           Congress\n          </a>\n          meets:\n          <br/>\n          the\n          <a href="/wiki/United_States_Senate" title="United States Senate">\n           Senate\n          </a>\n          , left; the\n          <a href="/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="United States House of Representatives">\n           House\n          </a>\n          , right\n         </div>\n        </div>\n        <div class="tsingle" style="margin:1px;width:202px;max-width:202px">\n         <div class="thumbimage">\n          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:WhiteHouseSouthFacade.JPG">\n           <img alt="" data-file-height="1196" data-file-width="1614" height="148" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/WhiteHouseSouthFacade.JPG/200px-WhiteHouseSouthFacade.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/WhiteHouseSouthFacade.JPG/300px-WhiteHouseSouthFacade.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/WhiteHouseSouthFacade.JPG/400px-WhiteHouseSouthFacade.JPG 2x" width="200"/>\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left;text-align:center">\n          The\n          <a href="/wiki/White_House" title="White House">\n           White House\n          </a>\n          , home and workplace of the\n          <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">\n           U.S. President\n          </a>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n        <div class="tsingle" style="margin:1px;width:202px;max-width:202px">\n         <div class="thumbimage">\n          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:USSupremeCourtWestFacade.JPG">\n           <img alt="" data-file-height="1331" data-file-width="1871" height="142" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/USSupremeCourtWestFacade.JPG/200px-USSupremeCourtWestFacade.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/USSupremeCourtWestFacade.JPG/300px-USSupremeCourtWestFacade.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/USSupremeCourtWestFacade.JPG/400px-USSupremeCourtWestFacade.JPG 2x" width="200"/>\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left;text-align:center">\n          <a href="/wiki/United_States_Supreme_Court_Building" title="United States Supreme Court Building">\n           Supreme Court Building\n          </a>\n          , where the\n          <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States" title="Supreme Court of the United States">\n           nation\'s highest court\n          </a>\n          sits\n         </div>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The United States is the world\'s oldest surviving\n       <a href="/wiki/Federation" title="Federation">\n        federation\n       </a>\n       . It is a\n       <a href="/wiki/Representative_democracy" title="Representative democracy">\n        representative democracy\n       </a>\n       , "in which\n       <a href="/wiki/Majority_rule" title="Majority rule">\n        majority rule\n       </a>\n       is tempered by\n       <a href="/wiki/Minority_rights" title="Minority rights">\n        minority rights\n       </a>\n       protected by\n       <a href="/wiki/Law_of_the_United_States" title="Law of the United States">\n        law\n       </a>\n       ".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-354">\n        <a href="#cite_note-354">\n         [341]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The government is regulated by a system of\n       <a href="/wiki/Separation_of_powers" title="Separation of powers">\n        checks and balances\n       </a>\n       defined by the U.S. Constitution, which serves as the country\'s supreme legal document.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-355">\n        <a href="#cite_note-355">\n         [342]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       For 2016, the U.S. ranked 21st on the\n       <a href="/wiki/Democracy_Index" title="Democracy Index">\n        Democracy Index\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-356">\n        <a href="#cite_note-356">\n         [343]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       (tied with\n       <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">\n        Italy\n       </a>\n       ) and 18th on the\n       <a href="/wiki/Corruption_Perceptions_Index" title="Corruption Perceptions Index">\n        Corruption Perceptions Index\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-357">\n        <a href="#cite_note-357">\n         [344]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In the\n       <a href="/wiki/Federalism#United_States" title="Federalism">\n        American federalist system\n       </a>\n       , citizens are usually subject to\n       <a href="/wiki/Political_divisions_of_the_United_States" title="Political divisions of the United States">\n        three levels of government\n       </a>\n       : federal, state, and local. The\n       <a href="/wiki/Local_government_in_the_United_States" title="Local government in the United States">\n        local government\n       </a>\n       \'s duties are commonly split between\n       <a href="/wiki/County_(United_States)" title="County (United States)">\n        county\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Municipal_corporation" title="Municipal corporation">\n        municipal governments\n       </a>\n       . In almost all cases, executive and legislative officials are elected by a\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Plurality_voting_system" title="Plurality voting system">\n        plurality vote\n       </a>\n       of citizens by district. There is no\n       <a href="/wiki/Proportional_representation" title="Proportional representation">\n        proportional representation\n       </a>\n       at the federal level, and it is rare at lower levels.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-358">\n        <a href="#cite_note-358">\n         [345]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The federal government is composed of three branches:\n      </p>\n      <ul>\n       <li>\n        <a href="/wiki/Legislature" title="Legislature">\n         Legislative\n        </a>\n        : The\n        <a href="/wiki/Bicameralism" title="Bicameralism">\n         bicameral\n        </a>\n        <a href="/wiki/United_States_Congress" title="United States Congress">\n         Congress\n        </a>\n        , made up of the\n        <a href="/wiki/United_States_Senate" title="United States Senate">\n         Senate\n        </a>\n        and the\n        <a href="/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="United States House of Representatives">\n         House of Representatives\n        </a>\n        , makes\n        <a href="/wiki/Federal_law" title="Federal law">\n         federal law\n        </a>\n        ,\n        <a href="/wiki/Declaration_of_war" title="Declaration of war">\n         declares war\n        </a>\n        , approves treaties, has the\n        <a href="/wiki/Power_of_the_purse" title="Power of the purse">\n         power of the purse\n        </a>\n        ,\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-359">\n         <a href="#cite_note-359">\n          [346]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n        and has the power of\n        <a href="/wiki/Impeachment" title="Impeachment">\n         impeachment\n        </a>\n        , by which it can remove sitting members of the government.\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-360">\n         <a href="#cite_note-360">\n          [347]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        <a href="/wiki/Executive_(government)" title="Executive (government)">\n         Executive\n        </a>\n        :\n        <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">\n         The President\n        </a>\n        is the\n        <a href="/wiki/Commander-in-chief" title="Commander-in-chief">\n         commander-in-chief\n        </a>\n        of the military, can veto\n        <a href="/wiki/Bill_(law)" title="Bill (law)">\n         legislative bills\n        </a>\n        before they become law (subject to Congressional override), and appoints the\n        <a href="/wiki/Cabinet_of_the_United_States" title="Cabinet of the United States">\n         members of the Cabinet\n        </a>\n        (subject to Senate approval) and other officers, who administer and enforce federal laws and policies.\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-361">\n         <a href="#cite_note-361">\n          [348]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n       </li>\n       <li>\n        <a href="/wiki/Judiciary" title="Judiciary">\n         Judicial\n        </a>\n        : The\n        <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States" title="Supreme Court of the United States">\n         Supreme Court\n        </a>\n        and lower\n        <a href="/wiki/Federal_judiciary_of_the_United_States" title="Federal judiciary of the United States">\n         federal courts\n        </a>\n        , whose judges are appointed by the President with Senate approval, interpret laws and overturn those they find\n        <a href="/wiki/Constitutionality" title="Constitutionality">\n         unconstitutional\n        </a>\n        .\n        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-362">\n         <a href="#cite_note-362">\n          [349]\n         </a>\n        </sup>\n       </li>\n      </ul>\n      <p>\n       The House of Representatives has 435 voting members, each representing a\n       <a href="/wiki/Congressional_district" title="Congressional district">\n        congressional district\n       </a>\n       for a two-year term. House seats are\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_congressional_apportionment" title="United States congressional apportionment">\n        apportioned\n       </a>\n       among the states by population every tenth year. At the\n       <a href="/wiki/2000_United_States_Census" title="2000 United States Census">\n        2010 census\n       </a>\n       , seven states had the minimum of one representative, while California, the most populous state, had 53.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-363">\n        <a href="#cite_note-363">\n         [350]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The Senate has 100 members with each state having two senators, elected\n       <a href="/wiki/At-large" title="At-large">\n        at-large\n       </a>\n       to six-year terms; one third of Senate seats are up for election every other year. The President serves a four-year term and may be elected to the office\n       <a href="/wiki/Term_limits_in_the_United_States" title="Term limits in the United States">\n        no more than twice\n       </a>\n       . The President is\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_presidential_election" title="United States presidential election">\n        not elected by direct vote\n       </a>\n       , but by an indirect\n       <a href="/wiki/Electoral_College_(United_States)" title="Electoral College (United States)">\n        electoral college\n       </a>\n       system in which the determining votes are apportioned to the states and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Washington,_D.C." title="Washington, D.C.">\n        District of Columbia\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-364">\n        <a href="#cite_note-364">\n         [351]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The Supreme Court, led by the\n       <a href="/wiki/Chief_Justice_of_the_United_States" title="Chief Justice of the United States">\n        Chief Justice of the United States\n       </a>\n       , has nine members, who serve for life.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-365">\n        <a href="#cite_note-365">\n         [352]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The state governments are structured in roughly similar fashion;\n       <a href="/wiki/Nebraska" title="Nebraska">\n        Nebraska\n       </a>\n       uniquely has a\n       <a href="/wiki/Unicameralism" title="Unicameralism">\n        unicameral\n       </a>\n       legislature.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-366">\n        <a href="#cite_note-366">\n         [353]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The\n       <a href="/wiki/Governor_(United_States)" title="Governor (United States)">\n        governor\n       </a>\n       (chief executive) of each state is directly elected. Some state judges and cabinet officers are appointed by the governors of the respective states, while others are elected by popular vote.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The original text of the Constitution establishes the structure and responsibilities of the federal government and its relationship with the individual states.\n       <a href="/wiki/Article_One_of_the_United_States_Constitution" title="Article One of the United States Constitution">\n        Article One\n       </a>\n       protects the right to the "great writ" of\n       <a href="/wiki/Habeas_corpus_in_the_United_States" title="Habeas corpus in the United States">\n        habeas corpus\n       </a>\n       . The Constitution has been amended 27 times;\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-367">\n        <a href="#cite_note-367">\n         [354]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       the first ten amendments, which make up the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Bill_of_Rights" title="United States Bill of Rights">\n        Bill of Rights\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Fourteenth_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution" title="Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution">\n        Fourteenth Amendment\n       </a>\n       form the central basis of Americans\' individual rights. All laws and governmental procedures are subject to\n       <a href="/wiki/Judicial_review" title="Judicial review">\n        judicial review\n       </a>\n       and any law ruled by the courts to be in violation of the Constitution is voided. The principle of judicial review, not explicitly mentioned in the Constitution, was established by the Supreme Court in\n       <i>\n        <a href="/wiki/Marbury_v._Madison" title="Marbury v. Madison">\n         Marbury v. Madison\n        </a>\n       </i>\n       (1803)\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-368">\n        <a href="#cite_note-368">\n         [355]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       in a decision handed down by\n       <a href="/wiki/John_Marshall" title="John Marshall">\n        Chief Justice John Marshall\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-369">\n        <a href="#cite_note-369">\n         [356]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Political_divisions">\n        Political divisions\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/Political_divisions_of_the_United_States" title="Political divisions of the United States">\n        Political divisions of the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/U.S._state" title="U.S. state">\n        U.S. state\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Territories_of_the_United_States" title="Territories of the United States">\n        Territories of the United States\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_states_and_territories_of_the_United_States" title="List of states and territories of the United States">\n        List of states and territories of the United States\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a href="/wiki/Indian_reservation" title="Indian reservation">\n        Indian reservation\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Further information:\n       <a href="/wiki/Territorial_evolution_of_the_United_States" title="Territorial evolution of the United States">\n        Territorial evolution of the United States\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_territorial_acquisitions" title="United States territorial acquisitions">\n        United States territorial acquisitions\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tleft">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="647" data-file-width="754" height="189" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png/220px-US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png/330px-US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png/440px-US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:US.EEZ_Pacific_centered_NOAA_map.png" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         Map of U.S.\n         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Economic_Exclusion_Zone" title="Economic Exclusion Zone">\n          Economic Exclusion Zone\n         </a>\n         ,\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-370">\n          <a href="#cite_note-370">\n           [357]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n         highlighting states, territories and possessions\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The United States is a federal republic of 50 states, a federal district, five territories and eleven uninhabited island possessions.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-371">\n        <a href="#cite_note-371">\n         [358]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The states and territories are the principal administrative districts in the country. These are divided into subdivisions of counties and independent cities. The District of Columbia is a federal district that contains the capital of the United States, Washington DC.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-372">\n        <a href="#cite_note-372">\n         [359]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The states and the District of Columbia choose the President of the United States. Each state has presidential electors equal to the number of their Representatives and Senators in Congress; the District of Columbia has three.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-373">\n        <a href="#cite_note-373">\n         [360]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Congressional Districts are reapportioned among the states following each decennial Census of Population. Each state then draws single member districts to conform with the census apportionment. The total number of Representatives is 435, and delegate Members of Congress represent the District of Columbia and the five major U.S. territories.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-374">\n        <a href="#cite_note-374">\n         [361]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The United States also observes\n       <a href="/wiki/Tribal_sovereignty_in_the_United_States" title="Tribal sovereignty in the United States">\n        tribal sovereignty\n       </a>\n       of the American Indian nations to a limited degree, as it does with the states\' sovereignty. American Indians are U.S. citizens and tribal lands are subject to the jurisdiction of the U.S. Congress and the federal courts. Like the states they have a great deal of autonomy, but also like the states, tribes are not allowed to make war, engage in their own foreign relations, or print and issue currency.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-375">\n        <a href="#cite_note-375">\n         [362]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <div aria-label="Navbox" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="background-color:WhiteSmoke; border:solid 1px Silver;;padding:3px">\n       <table class="nowraplinks navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit">\n        <tr>\n         <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2" style="background-color:Honeydew; border:solid 1px Silver; font-size:110%;">\n          <div>\n           <b>\n            State flags and statehood dates\n           </b>\n          </div>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd plainlist" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0px">\n          <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">\n          </div>\n          <table class="nowraplinks collapsible collapsed navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0">\n           <tr>\n            <th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col" style=";background-color:Honeydew; border:solid 1px Silver;">\n             <div id=".28listed_alphabetically.29" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">\n              (listed alphabetically)\n             </div>\n            </th>\n           </tr>\n           <tr>\n            <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0px;text-align: left;">\n             <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">\n              <div class="div-col columns column-width" style="-moz-column-width: 17em; -webkit-column-width: 17em; column-width: 17em;">\n               <ul>\n                <li>\n                 <span class="flagicon">\n                  <img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="400" data-file-width="600" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Alabama.svg/23px-Flag_of_Alabama.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Alabama.svg/35px-Flag_of_Alabama.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Alabama.svg/45px-Flag_of_Alabama.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>\n                 </span>\n                 <a href="/wiki/Alabama" title="Alabama">\n                  Alabama\n                 </a>\n                 :\xc2\xa0Dec. 14, 1819\n                </li>\n                <li>\n                 <span class="flagicon">\n                  <img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1000" data-file-width="1416" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e6/Flag_of_Alaska.svg/21px-Flag_of_Alaska.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e6/Flag_of_Alaska.svg/33px-Flag_of_Alaska.svg.png 1.5x, class="flagicon">\n                  <img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="667" data-file-width="1000" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Flag_of_Arizona.svg/23px-Flag_of_Arizona.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Flag_of_Arizona.svg/35px-Flag_of_Arizona.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Flag_of_Arizona.svg/45px-Flag_of_Arizona.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>\n                 </span>\n                 <a href="/wiki/Arizona" title="Arizona">\n                  Arizona\n                 </a>\n                </li>\n                <li>\n                 Jan. 3, 1959:\n                 <span class="flagicon">\n                  <img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1000" data-file-width="1416" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e6/Flag_of_Alaska.svg/21px-Flag_of_Alaska.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e6/Flag_of_Alaska.svg/33px-Flag_of_Alaska.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e6/Flag_of_Alaska.svg/43px-Flag_of_Alaska.svg.png 2x" width="21"/>\n                 </span>\n                 <a href="/wiki/Alaska" title="Alaska">\n                  Alaska\n                 </a>\n                </li>\n                <li>\n                 Aug. 21, 1959:\n                 <span class="flagicon">\n                  <img alt="" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1200" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Flag_of_Hawaii.svg/23px-Flag_of_Hawaii.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Flag_of_Hawaii.svg/35px-Flag_of_Hawaii.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/Flag_of_Hawaii.svg/46px-Flag_of_Hawaii.svg.png 2x" width="23"/>\n                 </span>\n                 <a href="/wiki/Hawaii" title="Hawaii">\n                  Hawaii\n                 </a>\n                </li>\n               </ul>\n              </div>\n             </div>\n            </td>\n           </tr>\n          </table>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n         <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2" style="background-color:Honeydew; border:solid 1px Silver; font-size:85%;">\n          <div>\n           <span class="nowrap">\n            Statehood date is the date of\n            <a href="/wiki/Article_Seven_of_the_United_States_Constitution" title="Article Seven of the United States Constitution">\n             ratifying the Constitution\n            </a>\n            (for the first 13)\n           </span>\n           <span class="nowrap">\n            or\n            <a href="/wiki/Admission_to_the_Union" title="Admission to the Union">\n             being admitted to the Union\n            </a>\n            (for subsequent states)\n           </span>\n          </div>\n         </td>\n        </tr>\n       </table>\n      </div>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Parties_and_elections">\n        Parties and elections\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_the_United_States" title="Politics of the United States">\n        Politics of the United States\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Political_ideologies_in_the_United_States" title="Political ideologies in the United States">\n        Political ideologies in the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:267px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="436" data-file-width="654" height="177" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg/265px-Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg/398px-Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg/530px-Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg 2x" width="265"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Obama_meets_with_Congressional_Leadership_July_2011.jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         Congressional leadership meeting with then-President\n         <a href="/wiki/Barack_Obama" title="Barack Obama">\n          Obama\n         </a>\n         in 2011.\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-376">\n          <a href="#cite_note-376">\n           [363]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tmulti tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:267px;max-width:267px">\n        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:136px;max-width:136px">\n         <div class="thumbimage">\n          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Official_Portrait_of_President_Donald_Trump_(cropped).jpg">\n           <img alt="" data-file-height="2096" data-file-width="1520" height="185" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/05/Official_Portrait_of_President_Donald_Trump_%28cropped%29.jpg/134px-Official_Portrait_of_President_Donald_Trump_%28cropped%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/05/Official_Portrait_of_President_Donald_Trump_%28cropped%29.jpg/201px-Official_Portrait_of_President_Donald_Trump_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/05/Official_Portrait_of_President_Donald_Trump_%28cropped%29.jpg/268px-Official_Portrait_of_President_Donald_Trump_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" width="134"/>\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left;text-align:center">\n          <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">\n           Donald Trump\n          </a>\n          <br/>\n          <small>\n           45th\n           <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">\n            President\n           </a>\n           <br/>\n           since January 20, 2017\n          </small>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n        <div class="tsingle" style="float:left;margin:1px;width:127px;max-width:127px">\n         <div class="thumbimage">\n          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Vice_President_Pence_Official_Portrait_(cropped).jpg">\n           <img alt="" data-file-height="2390" data-file-width="1781" height="168" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Vice_President_Pence_Official_Portrait_%28cropped%29.jpg/125px-Vice_President_Pence_Official_Portrait_%28cropped%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Vice_President_Pence_Official_Portrait_%28cropped%29.jpg/188px-Vice_President_Pence_Official_Portrait_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Vice_President_Pence_Official_Portrait_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Vice_President_Pence_Official_Portrait_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" width="125"/>\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         <div class="thumbcaption" style="clear:left;text-align:center">\n          <a href="/wiki/Mike_Pence" title="Mike Pence">\n           Mike Pence\n          </a>\n          <br/>\n          <small>\n           48th\n           <a href="/wiki/Vice_President_of_the_United_States" title="Vice President of the United States">\n            Vice President\n           </a>\n           <br/>\n           since January 20, 2017\n          </small>\n         </div>\n        </div>\n        <div style="clear:left">\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The United States has operated under a\n       <a href="/wiki/Two-party_system" title="Two-party system">\n        two-party system\n       </a>\n       for most of its history.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-twsNovGe_377-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-twsNovGe-377">\n         [364]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       For elective offices at most levels, state-administered\n       <a href="/wiki/Primary_election" title="Primary election">\n        primary elections\n       </a>\n       choose the major party\n       <a href="/wiki/Nomination" title="Nomination">\n        nominees\n       </a>\n       for subsequent\n       <a href="/wiki/General_election" title="General election">\n        general elections\n       </a>\n       . Since the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_presidential_election,_1856" title="United States presidential election, 1856">\n        general election of 1856\n       </a>\n       , the major parties have been the\n       <a href="/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States)" title="Democratic Party (United States)">\n        Democratic Party\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/History_of_the_United_States_Democratic_Party" title="History of the United States Democratic Party">\n        founded in 1824\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)" title="Republican Party (United States)">\n        Republican Party\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/History_of_the_United_States_Republican_Party" title="History of the United States Republican Party">\n        founded in 1854\n       </a>\n       . Since the Civil War, only one\n       <a href="/wiki/Third_party_(United_States)" title="Third party (United States)">\n        third-party\n       </a>\n       presidential candidate\xe2\x80\x94former president\n       <a href="/wiki/Theodore_Roosevelt" title="Theodore Roosevelt">\n        Theodore Roosevelt\n       </a>\n       , running as a\n       <a href="/wiki/Progressive_Party_(United_States,_1912)" title="Progressive Party (United States, 1912)">\n        Progressive\n       </a>\n       in\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_presidential_election,_1912" title="United States presidential election, 1912">\n        1912\n       </a>\n       \xe2\x80\x94has won as much as 20% of the popular vote. The President and Vice-president are elected through the\n       <a href="/wiki/Electoral_College_(United_States)" title="Electoral College (United States)">\n        Electoral College\n       </a>\n       system.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Avaliktos2004_378-0">\n        <a href="#cite_note-Avaliktos2004-378">\n         [365]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       Within American\n       <a href="/wiki/Political_culture" title="Political culture">\n        political culture\n       </a>\n       , the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Center-right_politics" title="Center-right politics">\n        center-right\n       </a>\n       Republican Party is considered "\n       <a href="/wiki/Conservatism_in_the_United_States" title="Conservatism in the United States">\n        conservative\n       </a>\n       " and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Centre-left_politics" title="Centre-left politics">\n        center-left\n       </a>\n       Democratic Party is considered "\n       <a href="/wiki/Modern_liberalism_in_the_United_States" title="Modern liberalism in the United States">\n        liberal\n       </a>\n       ".\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-379">\n        <a href="#cite_note-379">\n         [366]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-380">\n        <a href="#cite_note-380">\n         [367]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       The states of the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Politics_of_the_Northeastern_United_States" title="Politics of the Northeastern United States">\n        Northeast\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Politics_of_the_Western_United_States" title="Politics of the Western United States">\n        West Coast\n       </a>\n       and some of the Great Lakes states, known as "\n       <a href="/wiki/Red_states_and_blue_states" title="Red states and blue states">\n        blue states\n       </a>\n       ", are relatively liberal. The "\n       <a href="/wiki/Political_party_strength_in_U.S._states" title="Political party strength in U.S. states">\n        red states\n       </a>\n       " of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_the_Southern_United_States" title="Politics of the Southern United States">\n        South\n       </a>\n       and parts of the\n       <a href="/wiki/Midwestern_United_States#Political_trends" title="Midwestern United States">\n        Great Plains\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Politics_of_the_Western_United_States" title="Politics of the Western United States">\n        Rocky Mountains\n       </a>\n       are relatively conservative.\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)" title="Republican Party (United States)">\n        Republican\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">\n        Donald Trump\n       </a>\n       , the winner of the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/United_States_Presidential_Election,_2016" title="United States Presidential Election, 2016">\n        2016 presidential election\n       </a>\n       , is currently serving as the 45th\n       <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_United_States" title="President of the United States">\n        President of the United States\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-381">\n        <a href="#cite_note-381">\n         [368]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Current leadership in the Senate includes Republican Vice President\n       <a href="/wiki/Mike_Pence" title="Mike Pence">\n        Mike Pence\n       </a>\n       , Republican President Pro Tempore\n       <a href="/wiki/Orrin_Hatch" title="Orrin Hatch">\n        Orrin Hatch\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Party_leaders_of_the_United_States_Senate" title="Party leaders of the United States Senate">\n        Majority Leader\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Mitch_McConnell" title="Mitch McConnell">\n        Mitch McConnell\n       </a>\n       , and Minority Leader\n       <a href="/wiki/Chuck_Schumer" title="Chuck Schumer">\n        Chuck Schumer\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-382">\n        <a href="#cite_note-382">\n         [369]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Leadership in the House includes Speaker of the House\n       <a href="/wiki/Paul_Ryan" title="Paul Ryan">\n        Paul Ryan\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Party_leaders_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Party leaders of the United States House of Representatives">\n        Majority Leader\n       </a>\n       <a href="/wiki/Kevin_McCarthy_(California_politician)" title="Kevin McCarthy (California politician)">\n        Kevin McCarthy\n       </a>\n       , and Minority Leader\n       <a href="/wiki/Nancy_Pelosi" title="Nancy Pelosi">\n        Nancy Pelosi\n       </a>\n       .\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-383">\n        <a href="#cite_note-383">\n         [370]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       In the\n       <a href="/wiki/115th_United_States_Congress" title="115th United States Congress">\n        115th United States Congress\n       </a>\n       , both the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="United States House of Representatives">\n        House of Representatives\n       </a>\n       and the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_States_Senate" title="United States Senate">\n        Senate\n       </a>\n       are controlled by the Republican Party. The Senate currently consists of 52 Republicans, and 46 Democrats with 2\n       <a href="/wiki/Independent_politician" title="Independent politician">\n        Independents\n       </a>\n       who caucus with the Democrats; the House consists of 241 Republicans and 194 Democrats.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-384">\n        <a href="#cite_note-384">\n         [371]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       In state governorships, there are 33 Republicans, 16 Democrats, and 1 Independent.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-385">\n        <a href="#cite_note-385">\n         [372]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       Among the DC mayor and the 5 territorial governors, there are 2 Republicans, 1 Democrat, 1\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_Progressive_Party_of_Puerto_Rico" title="New Progressive Party of Puerto Rico">\n        New Progressive\n       </a>\n       , and 2 Independents.\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-386">\n        <a href="#cite_note-386">\n         [373]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <h3>\n       <span class="mw-headline" id="Foreign_relations">\n        Foreign relations\n       </span>\n      </h3>\n      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">\n       Main articles:\n       <a href="/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_the_United_States" title="Foreign relations of the United States">\n        Foreign relations of the United States\n       </a>\n       and\n       <a href="/wiki/Foreign_policy_of_the_United_States" title="Foreign policy of the United States">\n        Foreign policy of the United States\n       </a>\n      </div>\n      <div class="thumb tright">\n       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">\n        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_(8020913157).jpg">\n         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="3744" data-file-width="5616" height="147" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_%288020913157%29.jpg/220px-67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_%288020913157%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_%288020913157%29.jpg/330px-67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_%288020913157%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_%288020913157%29.jpg/440px-67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_%288020913157%29.jpg 2x" width="220"/>\n        </a>\n        <div class="thumbcaption">\n         <div class="magnify">\n          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:67%C2%BA_Per%C3%ADodo_de_Sesiones_de_la_Asamblea_General_de_Naciones_Unidas_(8020913157).jpg" title="Enlarge">\n          </a>\n         </div>\n         The\n         <a href="/wiki/Headquarters_of_the_United_Nations" title="Headquarters of the United Nations">\n          United Nations Headquarters\n         </a>\n         was built in\n         <a href="/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan" title="Midtown Manhattan">\n          Midtown Manhattan\n         </a>\n         in 1952.\n         <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Akenuwa2015_387-0">\n          <a href="#cite_note-Akenuwa2015-387">\n           [374]\n          </a>\n         </sup>\n        </div>\n       </div>\n      </div>\n      <p>\n       The United States has an established structure of foreign relations. It is a permanent member of the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council" title="United Nations Security Council">\n        United Nations Security Council\n       </a>\n       , and New York City is home to the\n       <a href="/wiki/Headquarters_of_the_United_Nations" title="Headquarters of the United Nations">\n        United Nations Headquarters\n       </a>\n       . It is a member of the\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/G7" title="G7">\n        G7\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-388">\n        <a href="#cite_note-388">\n         [375]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/G20" title="G20">\n        G20\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Organisation_for_Economic_Co-operation_and_Development" title="Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development">\n        Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development\n       </a>\n       . Almost all countries have\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_diplomatic_missions_in_the_United_States" title="List of diplomatic missions in the United States">\n        embassies\n       </a>\n       in Washington, D.C., and many have\n       <a href="/wiki/Consul_(representative)" title="Consul (representative)">\n        consulates\n       </a>\n       around the country. Likewise, nearly all nations host\n       <a href="/wiki/List_of_diplomatic_missions_of_the_United_States" title="List of diplomatic missions of the United States">\n        American diplomatic missions\n       </a>\n       . However,\n       <a href="/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Iran\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Iran\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/North_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="North Korea\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        North Korea\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Bhutan" title="Foreign relations of Bhutan">\n        Bhutan\n       </a>\n       , and the\n       <a href="/wiki/Taiwan%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Taiwan\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Republic of China\n       </a>\n       (Taiwan) do not have formal diplomatic relations with the United States (although the U.S. still maintains relations with Taiwan and supplies it with\n       <a href="/wiki/Six_Assurances" title="Six Assurances">\n        military equipment\n       </a>\n       ).\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-389">\n        <a href="#cite_note-389">\n         [376]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n      </p>\n      <p>\n       The United States has a "\n       <a href="/wiki/Special_Relationship" title="Special Relationship">\n        Special Relationship\n       </a>\n       " with the\n       <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="United Kingdom\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        United Kingdom\n       </a>\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-390">\n        <a href="#cite_note-390">\n         [377]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and strong ties with\n       <a href="/wiki/Canada%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Canada\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Canada\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-391">\n        <a href="#cite_note-391">\n         [378]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Australia%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Australia\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Australia\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-392">\n        <a href="#cite_note-392">\n         [379]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/New_Zealand%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="New Zealand\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        New Zealand\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-393">\n        <a href="#cite_note-393">\n         [380]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Philippines%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Philippines\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        the Philippines\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-394">\n        <a href="#cite_note-394">\n         [381]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Japan\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Japan\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-395">\n        <a href="#cite_note-395">\n         [382]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/South_Korea%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="South Korea\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        South Korea\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-396">\n        <a href="#cite_note-396">\n         [383]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       <a href="/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Israel\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Israel\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-397">\n        <a href="#cite_note-397">\n         [384]\n        </a>\n       </sup>\n       and several\n       <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">\n        European Union\n       </a>\n       countries, including\n       <a href="/wiki/France%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="France\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        France\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Italy%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Italy\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Italy\n       </a>\n       ,\n       <a href="/wiki/Germany%E2%80%93United_States_relations" title="Germany\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">\n        Germany\n       </a>\n       , and\n       <a
